ReferenceBlocks.text: Even the very hairs of your head are all numbered.

block.text: Sizin başınızdakı saçlar belә, sayılıb.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore don’t be afraid. You are of more value than many sparrows.

block.text: Ona görә dә qorxmayın, siz saysız-hesabsız sәrçәdәn daha dәyәrlisiniz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Everyone therefore who confesses me before men, him I will also confess before my Father who is in heaven.

block.text: İnsanlar qarşısında Mәni iqrar edәn hәr kәsi Mәn dә göylәrdә olan Atamın qarşısında iqrar edәcәyәm.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But whoever denies me before men, him I will also deny before my Father who is in heaven.

block.text: Amma kim insanlar qarşısında Mәni inkar etsә, Mәn dә onu göylәrdә olan Atamın qarşısında inkar edәcәyәm.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Don’t think that I came to send peace on the earth. I didn’t come to send peace, but a sword.

block.text: Düşünmәyin ki, yer üzünә sülh gәtirmәyә gәlmişәm. Mәn sülh deyil, qılınc gәtirmәyә gәlmişәm.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For I came to set a man at odds against his father, and a daughter against her mother, and a daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law.

block.text: Çünki Mәn oğulu atasından, qızı anasından, gәlini dә qayınanasından ayırmağa gәlmişәm.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A man’s foes will be those of his own household.

block.text: “İnsanın düşmәni öz ev әhli olacaq”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He who loves father or mother more than me is not worthy of me; and he who loves son or daughter more than me isn’t worthy of me.

block.text: Atasını ya anasını Mәndәn artıq sevәn kәs Mәnә layiq deyil. Oğlunu ya qızını Mәndәn artıq sevәn dә Mәnә layiq deyil.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He who doesn’t take his cross and follow after me, isn’t worthy of me.

block.text: Çarmıxını götürüb ardımca gәlmәyәn kәs dә Mәnә layiq deyil.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He who seeks his life will lose it; and he who loses his life for my sake will find it.

block.text: Canını qoruyan kәs onu itirәcәk, Mәnim uğrumda canını itirәnsә onu qoruyacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He who receives you receives me, and he who receives me receives him who sent me.

block.text: Sizi qәbul edәn kәs Mәni qәbul edәr. Mәni qәbul edәn dә Mәni Göndәrәni qәbul edәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He who receives a prophet in the name of a prophet will receive a prophet’s reward. He who receives a righteous man in the name of a righteous man will receive a righteous man’s reward.

block.text: Peyğәmbәri peyğәmbәr olduğu üçün qәbul edәn kәs peyğәmbәrә layiq bir mükafat alacaq. Salehi saleh olduğu üçün qәbul edәn dә salehә layiq bir mükafat alacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Whoever gives one of these little ones just a cup of cold water to drink in the name of a disciple, most certainly I tell you he will in no way lose his reward.”

block.text: Kim bu kiçiklәrdәn birinә şagird olduğu üçün hәtta bir kasa soyuq su içirdәrsә, sizә doğrusunu deyirәm: mükafatsız qalmayacaq>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW 11
It happened that when Jesus had finished directing his twelve disciples, he departed from there to teach and preach in their cities.

block.text: İsa On İki şagirdinә nәsihәt verib qurtarandan sonra öyrәdәrәk vәz etmәk üçün onların şәhәrlәrinә getdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now when John heard in the prison what Christ was doing, he sent two of his disciples
and said to him,

block.text: Yәhya isә Mәsihin işlәrini zindanda eşidәrәk öz şagirdlәrini göndәrib
Ondan soruşdu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Are you the one who comes, or should we look for another?”

block.text: <<Gәlmәli Olan Sәnsәnmi, yoxsa başqasını gözlәyәk?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered them,

block.text: İsa onlara belә cavab verdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Go and tell John the things which you hear and see:

block.text: <<Gedin, eşidib gördüklәrinizi Yәhyaya bildirin:

ReferenceBlocks.text: the blind receive their sight, the lame walk, the lepers are cleansed, the deaf hear, the dead are raised up, and the poor have good news preached to them.

block.text: korlar görür, axsaqlar yeriyir, cüzamlılar pak olur, karlar eşidir, ölülәr dirilir vә yoxsullara Müjdә yayılır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Blessed is he who finds no occasion for stumbling in me.”

block.text: Kim Mәnә görә büdrәmәsә, nә bәxtiyardır!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: As these went their way, Jesus began to say to the multitudes concerning John,

block.text: Onlar gedәrkәn İsa camaata Yәhya haqqında danışmağa başladı:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What did you go out into the wilderness to see? A reed shaken by the wind?

block.text: <<Çölә nәyә baxmağa getmişdiniz? Külәyin sarsıtdığı qamışamı?

ReferenceBlocks.text: But what did you go out to see? A man in soft clothing? Behold, those who wear soft clothing are in king’s houses.

block.text: Bәs onda nәyә baxmağa getmişdiniz? Nәfis toxunmuş paltar geymiş bir adamamı? Amma nәfis toxunmuş paltar geyәnlәr padşahların saraylarında qalır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But why did you go out? To see a prophet? Yes, I tell you, and much more than a prophet.

block.text: Bәs onda nәyә baxmağa getmişdiniz? Bir peyğәmbәrәmi? Bәli, sizә deyirәm, hәtta peyğәmbәrdәn dә üstün birinә.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For this is the one of whom it is written, ‘Behold, I send my messenger before your face, who will prepare your way before you.’

block.text: Bu o adamdır ki, onun haqqında yazılıb: “Budur, Sәnin önündә Öz elçimi göndәrirәm, O Sәnin qabağında yolunu hazırlayacaq”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Most certainly I tell you, among those who are born of women there has not arisen anyone greater than John the Baptizer; yet he who is least in the Kingdom of Heaven is greater than he.

block.text: Sizә doğrusunu deyirәm: qadından doğulanlar arasında Vәftizçi Yәhyadan daha üstün olan meydana çıxmayıb. Amma Sәmavi Padşahlıqda әn kiçik olan ondan üstündür.

ReferenceBlocks.text: From the days of John the Baptizer until now, the Kingdom of Heaven suffers violence, and the violent take it by force.

block.text: Vәftizçi Yәhyanın günlәrindәn indiyә qәdәr Sәmavi Padşahlıq zorla alınır vә zor işlәdәnlәr onu әlә keçirir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For all the prophets and the law prophesied until John.

block.text: Çünki bütün Peyğәmbәrlәr vә Qanun Yәhyaya qәdәr peyğәmbәrlik etdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If you are willing to receive it, this is Elijah, who is to come.

block.text: Әgәr onu qәbul etmәk istәyirsinizsә, gәlmәli olan İlyas odur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He who has ears to hear, let him hear.”

block.text: Qulağı olan eşitsin!

ReferenceBlocks.text: “But to what shall I compare this generation? It is like children sitting in the marketplaces, who call to their companions and say,

block.text: "Amma bu nəsil nə müqayisə edir mi? Bu pazarları oturan uşaqlar kimi. Onlar öz dostları üçün zəng və deyirlər:

ReferenceBlocks.text: ‘We played the flute for you, and you didn’t dance. We mourned for you, and you didn’t lament.’

block.text: 'Biz sizin üçün fleyta oynadı və rəqs etməyib. Biz sizin üçün yas tutdu, və ağlamaq deyil.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: For John came neither eating nor drinking, and they say, ‘He has a demon.’

block.text: Çünki Yәhya gәldikdә nә çörәk yeyir, nә şәrab içirdi vә onlar deyirlәr: “O, cinә tutulmuşdur”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Son of Man came eating and drinking, and they say, ‘Behold, a gluttonous man and a drunkard, a friend of tax collectors and sinners!’ But wisdom is justified by her children.”

block.text: Bәşәr Oğlu gәldikdә yeyib-içdi vә onlar deyirlәr: “Bu qarınqulu vә әyyaş adama baxın! Vergiyığanlara vә günahkarlara dost oldu!” Amma hikmәt öz әmәllәri ilә tәsdiq olunur>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he began to denounce the cities in which most of his mighty works had been done, because they didn’t repent.

block.text: Onda İsa bir çox möcüzәlәr göstәrdiyi şәhәrlәri tövbә etmәdiklәri üçün mәzәmmәt etmәyә başladı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Woe to you, Chorazin! Woe to you, Bethsaida! For if the mighty works had been done in Tyre and Sidon which were done in you, they would have repented long ago in sackcloth and ashes.

block.text: <<Vay halına, ey Korazin! Vay halına, ey Bet-Sayda! Sizdә baş vermiş möcüzәlәr Sur vә Sidonda olsaydı, onlar çoxdan çul geyinib külün üstündә oturaraq tövbә edәrdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But I tell you, it will be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon on the day of judgment than for you.

block.text: Amma sizә deyirәm: qiyamәt günü Sur vә Sidonun halı sizinkindәn daha asan olacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You, Capernaum, who are exalted to heaven, you will go down to Hades. For if the mighty works had been done in Sodom which were done in you, it would have remained until this day.

block.text: Sәn, ey Kefernahum, göyә qәdәr ucalacaqsanmı? Ölülәr diyarına qәdәr enәcәksәn. Çünki sәndә baş vermiş möcüzәlәr Sodomda olsaydı, o bu günә qәdәr durardı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But I tell you that it will be more tolerable for the land of Sodom, on the day of judgment, than for you.”

block.text: Ancaq Mәn sizә deyirәm: qiyamәt günü Sodom diyarının halı sәninkindәn daha asan olacaq>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: At that time, Jesus declared,

block.text: O vaxt İsa davam edәrәk dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I thank you, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, that you hid these things from the wise and understanding, and revealed them to infants.

block.text: <<Ey yerin-göyün Sahibi olan Ata! Sәndәn razıyam ki, bu şeylәri müdrik vә dәrrakәli adamlardan gizlәdib körpәlәrә agah etdin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Yes, Father, for it was pleasing in your sight.

block.text: Bәli, Ata! Çünki bu Sәnin xoş niyyәtin idi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: All things have been delivered to me by my Father. No one knows the Son, except the Father; neither does anyone know the Father, except the Son, and he to whom the Son desires to reveal him.”

block.text: Atam tәrәfindәn hәr şey Mәnim ixtiyarıma verildi. Oğulu Atadan başqa heç kәs tanımaz. Atanı da Oğuldan vә Oğulun agah etmәk istәdiyi şәxsdәn başqa heç kәs tanımaz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Come to me, all you who labor and are heavily burdened, and I will give you rest.

block.text: Ey bütün yorğunlar vә yüklәri ağır olanlar, Mәnim yanıma gәlin, Mәn sizә rahatlıq verәrәm.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Take my yoke upon you, and learn from me, for I am gentle and lowly in heart; and you will find rest for your souls.

block.text: Mәnim boyunduruğumu üzәrinizә götürün vә Mәndәn öyrәnin. Çünki Mәn hәlim vә qәlbәn itaәtkaram. Bununla canınıza rahatlıq taparsınız.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For my yoke is easy, and my burden is light.”

block.text: Çünki mәnim boyunduruğum rahat vә yüküm yüngüldür>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW 12
At that time, Jesus went on the Sabbath day through the grain fields. His disciples were hungry and began to pluck heads of grain and to eat.

block.text: O vaxtlar İsa bir Şәnbә günü taxıl zәmilәri arasından keçirdi. Şagirdlәri ac idi vә sünbüllәri qırıb yemәyә başladılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the Pharisees, when they saw it, said to him,

block.text: Fariseylәr bunu görüb Ona dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, your disciples do what is not lawful to do on the Sabbath.”

block.text: <<Budur, şagirdlәrin Şәnbә günü qadağan olunan işlәri görürlәr>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he said to them,

block.text: İsa onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Haven’t you read what David did, when he was hungry, and those who were with him;

block.text: <<Davud vә yanındakılar ac olanda nә etdiklәrini oxumamısınızmı?

ReferenceBlocks.text: how he entered into God’s house, and ate the show bread, which was not lawful for him to eat, neither for those who were with him, but only for the priests?

block.text: O, Allahın evinә girdi; ona vә yanındakılara deyil, yalnız kahinlәrә yemәyә icazә verilәn tәqdis çörәklәrini yedilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Or have you not read in the law, that on the Sabbath day, the priests in the temple profane the Sabbath, and are guiltless?

block.text: Elәcә dә Qanunda oxumamısınız ki, kahinlәr mәbәddә Şәnbәni pozurlar, lakin tәqsirsiz sayılırlar?

ReferenceBlocks.text: But I tell you that one greater than the temple is here.

block.text: Amma sizә deyirәm ki, mәbәddәn daha üstün Olan buradadır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But if you had known what this means, ‘I desire mercy, and not sacrifice,’ you would not have condemned the guiltless.

block.text: Әgәr siz “Mәn qurban deyil, mәrhәmәt istәyirәm” sözünün mәnasını bilsәydiniz, tәqsirsizlәri mәhkum etmәzdiniz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the Son of Man is Lord of the Sabbath.”

block.text: Ona görә ki Bәşәr Oğlu Şәnbә gününün Sahibidir>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He departed there, and went into their synagogue.

block.text: İsa oradan ayrılıb onların sinaqoquna girdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: And behold there was a man with a withered hand. In order to accuse Jesus, they asked him,

block.text: Budur, orada әli qurumuş bir adam var idi. Bәzi adamlar İsanı ittiham etmәk mәqsәdi ilә deyә soruşdular:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Is it lawful to heal on the Sabbath day?”

block.text: <<Şәnbә günü şәfa vermәyә icazә varmı?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: İsa onlara belә cavab verdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What man is there among you, who has one sheep, and if this one falls into a pit on the Sabbath day, won’t he grab on to it, and lift it out?

block.text: <<Hansınızın bir qoyunu olarsa vә qoyun Şәnbә günü çuxura düşәrsә, onu tutub çıxartmaz?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Of how much more value then is a man than a sheep! Therefore it is lawful to do good on the Sabbath day.”

block.text: İnsan qoyundan nә qәdәr dәyәrlidir! Belәliklә, Şәnbә günü xeyirxah iş görmәyә icazә var>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he told the man,

block.text: Sonra İsa adama dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Stretch out your hand.”

block.text: <<Әlini uzat!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He stretched it out; and it was restored whole, just like the other.

block.text: O, әlini uzatdı vә әli әvvәlki halına qayıdıb o biri әli kimi sağlam oldu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the Pharisees went out, and conspired against him, how they might destroy him.

block.text: Fariseylәr çıxıb İsanı necә mәhv etmәk barәdә mәslәhәtlәşdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus, perceiving that, withdrew from there. Great multitudes followed him; and he healed them all,
and commanded them, saying:

block.text: İsa bunu bilib oradan uzaqlaşdı. Böyük bir izdiham Onun ardınca getdi vә İsa onların hamısına şәfa verdi.
O, belə onlara əmr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do not make my presence known.”

block.text: "Mənim hüzurumda faş etmək etməyin."

ReferenceBlocks.text: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken through Isaiah the prophet, saying,

block.text: Bu, Yeşaya peyğәmbәr vasitәsilә söylәnәn hәmin söz yerinә yetsin deyә baş verdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, my servant whom I have chosen; my beloved in whom my soul is well pleased: I will put my Spirit on him. He will proclaim justice to the nations.

block.text: <<Budur, Mәnim seçdiyim Qulum! Mәnә sevimlidir, könlüm Ondan razıdır. Mәn Öz Ruhumu Onun üzәrinә qoyacağam. O, millәtlәrә әdalәt elan edәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He will not strive, nor shout; neither will anyone hear his voice in the streets.

block.text: O nә mübahisә, nә dә fәryad edәcәk. Küçәlәrdә heç kim Onun sәsini eşitmәyәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He won’t break a bruised reed. He won’t quench a smoking flax, until he leads justice to victory.

block.text: Әdalәti zәfәrә çatdırana qәdәr Әzilmiş qamışı qırmayacaq, Tüstülәnәn piltәni söndürmәyәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In his name, the nations will hope.”

block.text: Millәtlәr Onun adına ümid bağlayacaq>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then one possessed by a demon, blind and mute, was brought to him and he healed him, so that the blind and mute man both spoke and saw.

block.text: Ondan sonra İsanın yanına cinә tutulmuş kor vә lal bir adamı gәtirdilәr. İsa ona şәfa verdi. Belәcә o danışmağa vә görmәyә başladı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: All the multitudes were amazed, and said,

block.text: Bütün xalq deyә mat qaldı.

block.characterId: people who saw healing of demon-possessed man who was blind and mute

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: people who saw healing of demon-possessed man who was blind and mute
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Can this be the son of David?”

block.text: <<Bu, Davudun Oğlu deyilmi?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when the Pharisees heard it, they said,

block.text: Lakin fariseylәr bunu eşitdikdә dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This man does not cast out demons, except by Beelzebul, the prince of the demons.”

block.text: <<Bu Adam ancaq cinlәrin başçısı Baal-Zevulun gücü ilә cinlәri qovur>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Knowing their thoughts, Jesus said to them,

block.text: Fariseylәrin nә düşündüklәrini bilәn İsa onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Every kingdom divided against itself is brought to desolation, and every city or house divided against itself will not stand.

block.text: <<Öz daxilindәn bölünmüş hәr padşahlıq viran qalar vә öz daxilindәn bölünmüş hәr şәhәr yaxud ev davam gәtirmәz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If Satan casts out Satan, he is divided against himself. How then will his kingdom stand?

block.text: Әgәr Şeytan Şeytanı qovarsa, özü daxilindәn bölünmüş olur. Bu vәziyyәtdә onun padşahlığı necә davam gәtirәr?

ReferenceBlocks.text: If I by Beelzebul cast out demons, by whom do your children cast them out? Therefore they will be your judges.

block.text: Әgәr Mәn cinlәri Baal-Zevulun gücü ilә qovuramsa, bәs sizin adamlarınız kimin gücü ilә qovur? Buna görә dә onlar sizin hakimlәriniz olacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But if I by the Spirit of God cast out demons, then the Kingdom of God has come upon you.

block.text: Lakin Mәn cinlәri Allahın Ruhu ilә qovuramsa, demәli, Allahın Padşahlığı üzәrinizә gәlib.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Or how can one enter into the house of the strong man, and plunder his goods, unless he first bind the strong man? Then he will plunder his house.”

block.text: Bir kimsә güclü adamın evinә girib әvvәlcә onun әl-qolunu bağlamadan onun malını necә qarәt edә bilәr? Gәrәk o adamın әvvәlcә әl-qolunu bağlasın, sonra evini qarәt etsin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He who is not with me is against me, and he who doesn’t gather with me, scatters.

block.text: Mәnimlә olmayan Mәnә qarşıdır vә Mәnimlә yığmayan dağıdır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore I tell you, every sin and blasphemy will be forgiven men, but the blasphemy against the Spirit will not be forgiven men.

block.text: Buna görә sizә deyirәm: hәr bir günah vә hәr bir küfr insanlara bağışlanacaq; amma Ruha qarşı küfr bağışlanmayacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Whoever speaks a word against the Son of Man, it will be forgiven him; but whoever speaks against the Holy Spirit, it will not be forgiven him, neither in this age, nor in that which is to come.”

block.text: Kim Bәşәr Oğluna qarşı söz söylәrsә, bağışlanacaq; amma kim Müqәddәs Ruha qarşı söylәrsә, nә bu dövrdә bağışlanacaq, nә dә gәlәcәk dövrdә.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Either make the tree good, and its fruit good, or make the tree corrupt, and its fruit corrupt; for the tree is known by its fruit.

block.text: Ya ağaca yaxşı, bәhrәsinә dә yaxşı deyin yaxud ağaca pis, bәhrәsinә dә pis deyin; çünki ağac bәhrәsindәn tanınır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You offspring of vipers, how can you, being evil, speak good things? For out of the abundance of the heart, the mouth speaks.

block.text: Ey gürzәlәr nәsli, siz pis olduğunuz halda necә yaxşı şeylәr söylәyә bilәrsiniz? Çünki ürәk doluluğundan ağız danışar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The good man out of his good treasure of the heart brings out good things, and the evil man out of his evil treasure brings out evil things.

block.text: Yaxşı adam yaxşılıq xәzinәsindәn yaxşı şeylәr çıxarır, pis adam isә pislik xәzinәsindәn pis şeylәr çıxarır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I tell you that every idle word that men speak, they will give account of it in the day of judgment.

block.text: Mәn sizә deyirәm: insanlar söylәdiklәri hәr boş söz üçün qiyamәt günü hesab verәcәklәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For by your words you will be justified, and by your words you will be condemned.”

block.text: Çünki öz sözlәrinә görә haqq qazanacaqsan vә öz sözlәrinә görә mәhkum olunacaqsan>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then certain of the scribes and Pharisees answered,

block.text: O zaman bәzi ilahiyyatçılar vә fariseylәr İsaya dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Teacher, we want to see a sign from you.”

block.text: <<Müәllim, Sәndәn bir әlamәt görmәk istәyirik>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he answered them,

block.text: İsa onlara belә cavab verdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “An evil and adulterous generation seeks after a sign, but no sign will be given it but the sign of Jonah the prophet.

block.text: <<Pis vә vәfasız nәsil bir әlamәt axtarır. Amma ona Yunus peyğәmbәrin әlamәtindәn başqa heç bir әlamәt verilmәyәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For as Jonah was three days and three nights in the belly of the whale, so will the Son of Man be three days and three nights in the heart of the earth.

block.text: Çünki Yunus üç gün-üç gecә nәhәng balığın qarnında necә qalmışdısa, Bәşәr Oğlu da üç gün-üç gecә yerin bağrında elә qalacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The men of Nineveh will stand up in the judgment with this generation, and will condemn it, for they repented at the preaching of Jonah; and behold, someone greater than Jonah is here.

block.text: Nineva xalqı qiyamәt günündә bu nәsillә birgә qalxıb onu mәhkum edәcәk. Çünki onlar Yunusun vәzinә görә tövbә etmişdilәr. Budur, Yunusdan daha böyük Olan buradadır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The queen of the south will rise up in the judgment with this generation, and will condemn it, for she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon; and behold, one greater than Solomon is here.

block.text: Cәnub mәlәkәsi qiyamәt günündә bu nәsillә birgә qalxıb onu mәhkum edәcәk. Çünki mәlәkә Süleymanın hikmәtli sözlәrini dinlәmәk üçün yer üzünün ucqarlarından gәlmişdi. Budur, Süleymandan daha böyük Olan buradadır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the unclean spirit, when he is gone out of the man, passes through waterless places, seeking rest, and doesn’t find it.

block.text: Natәmiz ruh adamdan çıxdıqdan sonra quraq yerlәrdә dolaşar, rahatlıq axtarar, lakin tapmaz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he says, ‘I will return into my house from which I came out,’ and when he has come back, he finds it empty, swept, and put in order.

block.text: O zaman deyәr: “Çıxdığım evә dönüm”. Evә qayıdanda onu boş, süpürülmüş vә sәliqә-sahman içindә görәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he goes, and takes with himself seven other spirits more evil than he is, and they enter in and dwell there. The last state of that man becomes worse than the first. Even so will it be also to this evil generation.”

block.text: Bu vaxt o gedib özündәn daha betәr yeddi başqa ruhu özü ilә götürәr. Onlar da oraya girib mәskunlaşar. Onda bu adamın axırı әvvәlkindәn daha pis olar. Bu pis nәslin dә başına belә iş gәlәcәk>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: While he was yet speaking to the multitudes, behold, his mother and his brothers stood outside, seeking to speak to him.
One said to him,

block.text: İsa camaatla söhbәt edәndә anası vә qardaşları bayırda durub Onunla danışmaq istәyirdilәr.
Bir nәfәr İsaya dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, your mother and your brothers stand outside, seeking to speak to you.”

block.text: <<Budur, anan vә qardaşların bayırda durub Sәninlә danışmaq istәyirlәr>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he answered him who spoke to him,

block.text: İsa isә bu sözü söylәyәnә cavab verib dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who is my mother? Who are my brothers?”

block.text: <<Mәnim anam vә qardaşlarım kimlәrdir?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He stretched out his hand towards his disciples, and said,

block.text: Әlini şagirdlәrinә doğru uzadaraq dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, my mother and my brothers!

block.text: <<Mәnim anam vә qardaşlarım bunlardır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For whoever does the will of my Father who is in heaven, he is my brother, and sister, and mother.”

block.text: Çünki kim göylәrdә olan Atamın iradәsini yerinә yetirirsә, Mәnim qardaşım, bacım vә anam odur>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW 13
On that day Jesus went out of the house, and sat by the seaside.

block.text: O gün İsa evdәn çıxdı vә gedib göl kәnarında oturdu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Great multitudes gathered to him, so that he entered into a boat, and sat, and all the multitude stood on the beach.

block.text: Yanına elә böyük izdiham toplaşdı ki, Özü bir qayığa minib oturdu vә bütün izdiham sahildә durdu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He spoke to them many things in parables, saying,

block.text: İsa onlara mәsәllәrlә bir çox şey öyrәdәrәk dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, a farmer went out to sow.
As he sowed, some seeds fell by the roadside, and the birds came and devoured them.

block.text: <<Bir әkinçi toxum sәpmәyә çıxdı.
Sәpin zamanı toxumlardan bәzisi yol kәnarına düşdü vә quşlar gәlib onları dәnlәdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Others fell on rocky ground, where they didn’t have much soil, and immediately they sprang up, because they had no depth of earth.

block.text: Bәzisi torpağı çox olmayan daş-kәsәkli yerlәrә düşdü. Torpağı dәrin olmadığına görә tez cücәrdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the sun had risen, they were scorched. Because they had no root, they withered away.

block.text: Lakin günәş doğanda qarsalandı vә kökü olmadığına görә qurudu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Others fell among thorns. The thorns grew up and choked them.

block.text: Bәzisi tikanlar arasına düşdü. Tikanlar böyüyüb onları boğdu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Others fell on good soil, and yielded fruit: some one hundred times as much, some sixty, and some thirty.

block.text: Başqaları isә münbit torpağa düşdü. Bәzisi yüz, bәzisi altmış, bәzisi otuz qat sәmәrә verdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He who has ears to hear, let him hear.”

block.text: Qulağı olan eşitsin!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The disciples came, and said to him,

block.text: Şagirdlәr İsaya yaxınlaşıb dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why do you speak to them in parables?”

block.text: <<Nә üçün onlara mәsәllәrlә danışırsan?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He answered them,

block.text: O isә onlara belә cavab verdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “To you it is given to know the mysteries of the Kingdom of Heaven, but it is not given to them.

block.text: <<Sәmavi Padşahlığın sirlәrini bilmә qabiliyyәti sizә verilmişdir, lakin onlara verilmәmişdir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For whoever has, to him will be given, and he will have abundance, but whoever doesn’t have, from him will be taken away even that which he has.

block.text: Çünki kimin varıdırsa, ona daha çox verilәcәk vә o, bolluq içindә olacaq. Amma kimin yoxudursa, әlindә olan da ondan alınacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore I speak to them in parables, because seeing they don’t see, and hearing, they don’t hear, neither do they understand.

block.text: Mәnim onlarla mәsәllәrlә danışmağımın mәqsәdi budur ki, “gördüklәri halda görmәzlәr, eşitdiklәri halda eşitmәzlәr vә anlamazlar”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In them the prophecy of Isaiah is fulfilled, which says, ‘By hearing you will hear, and will in no way understand; Seeing you will see, and will in no way perceive:

block.text: Yeşaya peyğәmbәrin onlar üçün dediyi bu sözlәr yerinә yetir: “Eşitdikcә eşidәcәksiniz, amma anlamayacaqsınız, Gördükcә görәcәksiniz, amma qanmayacaqsınız.

ReferenceBlocks.text: for this people’s heart has grown callous, their ears are dull of hearing, they have closed their eyes; or else perhaps they might perceive with their eyes, hear with their ears, understand with their heart, and should turn again; and I would heal them.’”

block.text: Çünki bu xalqın ürәyi kütlәşdi, Qulaqları ağır eşitdi, Gözlәrini yumdular ki, Gözlәri ilә görmәsinlәr, Qulaqları ilә eşitmәsinlәr, Ürәklәri ilә anlamasınlar Vә Mәnә sarı dönmәsinlәr ki, Mәn onlara şәfa verim”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “But blessed are your eyes, for they see; and your ears, for they hear.

block.text: Amma sizin gözlәriniz nә bәxtiyardır, çünki görürlәr vә qulaqlarınız nә bәxtiyardır, çünki eşidirlәr!

ReferenceBlocks.text: For most certainly I tell you that many prophets and righteous men desired to see the things which you see, and didn’t see them; and to hear the things which you hear, and didn’t hear them.”

block.text: Sizә doğrusunu deyirәm: bir çox peyğәmbәrlәr vә saleh adamlar sizin gördüklәrinizi görmәyi arzuladılar, amma görmәdilәr, eşitdiklәrinizi eşitmәyi arzuladılar, amma eşitmәdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Hear, then, the parable of the farmer.

block.text: İndi әkinçi barәdә mәsәlin izahını dinlәyin:

ReferenceBlocks.text: When anyone hears the word of the Kingdom, and doesn’t understand it, the evil one comes, and snatches away that which has been sown in his heart. This is what was sown by the roadside.

block.text: kim Sәmavi Padşahlıqla bağlı kәlamı eşidib anlamırsa, şәr olan gәlib onun ürәyindә sәpilmiş olanı oğurlayır. Yol kәnarına sәpilәn toxum budur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: What was sown on the rocky places, this is he who hears the word, and immediately with joy receives it;

block.text: Daş-kәsәkli yerlәrә sәpilәn isә kәlamı eşidir vә dәrhal sevinclә qәbul edir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But since he has no root in himself, he only endures for a short time. When oppression or persecution arises because of the word, immediately he stumbles.

block.text: Lakin onda kök olmadığına görә dözümü az olur, kәlama görә әziyyәt vә tәqibә mәruz qalan kimi yıxılır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: What was sown among the thorns, this is he who hears the word, but the cares of this age and the deceitfulness of riches choke the word, and he becomes unfruitful.

block.text: Tikanlar arasına sәpilәn odur ki, kәlamı eşidir, lakin bu dövrün qayğıları vә var-dövlәtin aldadıcılığı kәlamı boğur vә kәlam barsız olur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: What was sown on the good ground, this is he who hears the word, and understands it, who most certainly bears fruit, and brings forth, some one hundred times as much, some sixty, and some thirty.”

block.text: Münbit torpağa sәpilәnsә odur ki, kәlamı eşidir, anlayır vә doğrudan da, sәmәrә – bәzisi yüz, bәzisi altmış, bәzisi otuz qat sәmәrә verir>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He set another parable before them, saying,

block.text: İsa onlara başqa bir mәsәl dә çәkdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The Kingdom of Heaven is like a man who sowed good seed in his field.

block.text: <<Sәmavi Padşahlıq tarlasına yaxşı toxum sәpmiş bir adama bәnzәyir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But while everyone was sleeping, his enemy came and sowed weeds among the wheat, and went away.

block.text: Adamlar yatanda onun düşmәni gәlib buğdaların arasına dәlicә sәpib getdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the blade sprang up and brought forth fruit, the weeds appeared also.

block.text: Buğda böyüyüb bәhrә verәndә dәlicәlәr dә göründü.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The servants of the householder came and said to him, ‘Sir, didn’t you sow good seed in your field? Where did these weeds come from?’”

block.text: Ev sahibinin qulları gәlib ona belә dedilәr: “Ağa, sәn tarlana yaxşı toxum sәpmәdinmi? Bәs bu dәlicә haradan әmәlә gәldi?”

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He said to them, ‘An enemy has done this.’ The servants asked him, ‘Do you want us to go and gather them up?’”

block.text: O isә qullara dedi: “Bunu düşmәn etmişdir”. Qullar da ona dedilәr: “İstәyirsәnmi gedib onları çıxaraq?”

ReferenceBlocks.text: “But he said, ‘No, lest perhaps while you gather up the weeds, you root up the wheat with them.

block.text: O dedi: “Yox, çünki dәlicәlәri çıxararkәn onlarla birgә buğdanı da qopararsınız.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Let both grow together until the harvest, and in the harvest time I will tell the reapers, First, gather up the weeds, and bind them in bundles to burn them; but gather the wheat into my barn.’”

block.text: Qoy biçinә qәdәr hәr ikisi birlikdә böyüsün. Biçin vaxtı mәn biçinçilәrә deyәcәyәm: ‹Әvvәlcә dәlicәlәri toplayın vә yandırmaq üçün onlardan dәrz bağlayın, buğdanı isә anbarlarıma toplayın›”>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He set another parable before them, saying,

block.text: İsa onlara başqa bir mәsәl dә danışaraq dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The Kingdom of Heaven is like a grain of mustard seed, which a man took, and sowed in his field;

block.text: <<Sәmavi Padşahlıq bir adamın götürüb öz tarlasında sәpdiyi xardal toxumuna bәnzәyir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: which indeed is smaller than all seeds. But when it is grown, it is greater than the herbs, and becomes a tree, so that the birds of the air come and lodge in its branches.”

block.text: Xardal toxumu bütün toxumların әn kiçiyi olsa da, böyüdükdә bütün bostan bitkilәrindәn hündür, lap ağac boyda olur. Belә ki göydә uçan quşlar gәlib onun budaqlarında yuva qurur>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He spoke another parable to them.

block.text: İsa onlara başqa bir mәsәl dә söylәdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The Kingdom of Heaven is like yeast, which a woman took, and hid in three measures of meal, until it was all leavened.”

block.text: <<Sәmavi Padşahlıq xәmir mayasına bәnzәyir. Qadın onu götürüb üç kisә una qarışdırıb bütün xәmir acıyanadәk saxlayır>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus spoke all these things in parables to the multitudes; He didn’t say anything to them without using a parable.

block.text: İsa bütün bu şeylәri xalqa mәsәllәrlә söylәyirdi vә onlara mәsәlsiz heç bir şey söylәmәzdi ki,

ReferenceBlocks.text: So was fulfilled that which was spoken through the prophet:

block.text: peyğәmbәr vasitәsilә söylәnәn bu söz yerinә yetsin:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I will open my mouth in parables; I will utter things hidden from the foundation of the world.”

block.text: <<Ağzımı mәsәllәrlә açacağam, Dünya yaranandan bәri Gizli qalan şeylәri bәyan edәcәyәm>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then Jesus sent the multitudes away, and went into the house. His disciples came to him, saying,

block.text: O zaman İsa xalqdan ayrılıb evә girdi. Şagirdlәri Onun yanına gәlib dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Explain to us the parable of the weeds of the field.”

block.text: <<Tarladakı dәlicәlәr mәsәlini bizә izah et>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He answered them,

block.text: Cavabında İsa dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He who sows the good seed is the Son of Man.

block.text: <<Yaxşı toxumu sәpәn Bәşәr Oğludur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The field is the world, and the good seed are the children of the Kingdom. The weeds are the children of the evil one.

block.text: Tarla isә dünyadır. Yaxşı toxum Padşahlığın övladlarıdır. Dәlicә isә şәr olanın övladlarıdır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The enemy who sowed them is the devil. The harvest is the end of the age, and the reapers are angels.

block.text: Dәlicәlәri sәpmiş olan düşmәn iblisdir. Biçin dövrün sonudur vә biçinçilәr isә mәlәklәrdir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As therefore the weeds are gathered up and burned with fire; so will it be at the end of this age.

block.text: Dәlicәlәr toplanıb alovla yandırıldığı kimi bu dövrün sonunda da belә olacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Son of Man will send out his angels, and they will weed out of his Kingdom all things that cause stumbling, and those who do iniquity.

block.text: Rəbb onun mələkləri həyata göndərir. Onlar onun Krallığının alaq həyata büdrəmə səbəb olan hər şeyi edəcək və günah görən bütün bu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They will cast them into the furnace of fire where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.

block.text: Onlar od onları tökmə olacaq. Orada ağlaya-ağlaya və orada diş gnashing olunacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then the righteous will shine forth like the sun in the Kingdom of their Father. He who has ears to hear, let him hear.”

block.text: Sonra saleh atalarının Krallığında günəş kimi irəli parlaq olacaq. Eşitmək qulaqları vardır, o, ona eşitdirərdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Again, the Kingdom of Heaven is like a treasure hidden in the field, which a man found, and hid. In his joy, he goes and sells all that he has, and buys that field.”

block.text: Sәmavi Padşahlıq tarlada gizlәdilәn bir dәfinәyә bәnzәyir. Tapan adam onu gizlәtdi, sevinclә gedib bütün varını satdı vә o tarlanı satın aldı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Again, the Kingdom of Heaven is like a man who is a merchant seeking fine pearls.

block.text: Yenә Sәmavi Padşahlıq gözәl mirvarilәr axtaran bir tacirә bәnzәyir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Having found one pearl of great price, he went and sold all that he had, and bought it.”

block.text: O, çox dәyәrli olan bir mirvari tapanda gedib bütün varını satdı vә onu satın aldı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Again, the Kingdom of Heaven is like a dragnet, that was cast into the sea, and gathered some fish of every kind.

block.text: Yenә Sәmavi Padşahlıq dәnizә atılan vә hәr cür balıq tutan bir tora bәnzәyir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When it was filled, they drew up on the beach. They sat down, and gathered the good into containers, but the bad they threw away.

block.text: Tor dolduğu zaman onu sahilә çәkdilәr vә oturub yaxşılarını qablara yığdılar, pislәri isә kәnara atdılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So will it be in the end of the world. The angels will come forth, and separate the wicked from among the righteous.

block.text: Bu dövrün sonunda da belә olacaq. Mәlәklәr gәlib pislәri salehlәrin arasından kәnar edәcәklәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They will cast them into the furnace of fire. There will be the weeping and the gnashing of teeth.”

block.text: Sonra onları odlu sobaya atacaqlar. Orada ağlaşma vә diş qıcırtısı olacaq>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to them,

block.text: İsa da onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Have you understood all these things?”

block.text: <<Bütün bunları anladınızmı?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They answered him,

block.text: deyә soruşdu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Yes, Lord.”

block.text: <<bәli, ya Rәbb>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: İsa da onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Therefore every scribe who has been made a disciple in the Kingdom of Heaven is like a man who is a householder, who brings out of his treasure new and old things.”

block.text: <<Ona görә dә Sәmavi Padşahlıq üçün şagirdlik etmiş hәr ilahiyyatçı xәzinәsindәn tәzә vә köhnә şeylәr çıxaran ev sahibinә bәnzәyir>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened that when Jesus had finished these parables, he departed from there.

block.text: İsa bu mәsәllәri bitirәndәn sonra oradan ayrıldı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Coming into his own country, he taught them in their synagogue, so that they were astonished, and said,

block.text: Öz doğma yurduna gәlәrәk oradakı sinaqoqda xalqı öyrәtmәyә başladı. Camaat tәәccüblәnәrәk dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Where did this man get this wisdom, and these mighty works?

block.text: <<Bu Adamda belә hikmәt, belә möcüzәlәr yaradan qüvvә haradandır?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Isn’t this the carpenter’s son? Isn’t his mother called Mary, and his brothers, James, Joses, Simon, and Judas?

block.text: Bu, dülgәrin Oğlu deyilmi? Anasının adı Mәryәm deyilmi? Yaqub, Yusif, Şimon vә Yәhuda Onun qardaşları deyilmi?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Aren’t all of his sisters with us? Where then did this man get all of these things?”

block.text: Bütün bacıları aramızda yaşamırmı? Bәs onda bu Adam üçün bütün bu şeylәr haradandır?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were offended by him. But Jesus said to them,

block.text: Onların İsaya acığı tutdu. Amma İsa onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “A prophet is not without honor, except in his own country, and in his own house.”

block.text: <<Bir peyğәmbәrә öz yurdundan vә öz evindәn başqa heç bir yerdә xor baxmazlar>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He didn’t do many mighty works there because of their unbelief.

block.text: İsa onların imansızlığı üzündәn orada çox möcüzә yaratmadı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW 14
At that time, Herod the tetrarch heard the report concerning Jesus,
and said to his servants,

block.text: O vaxt İsa barәdә olan xәbәrlәri hökmdar Hirod eşitdi.
Nökәrlәrinә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This is John the Baptizer. He is risen from the dead. That is why these powers work in him.”

block.text: <<Bu, Vәftizçi Yәhyadır. O, ölülәr arasından dirilib. Buna görә dә O, möcüzәlәr yaradır>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For Herod had captured John, bound him, and put him in prison because of Herodias, his brother Philip’s wife.
For John said to him,

block.text: Hirod qardaşı Filipin arvadı Hirodiyaya görә Yәhyanı tutduraraq qollarını qandalladıb zindana saldırmışdı.
Çünki Yәhya Hiroda demişdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It is not lawful for you to have her.”

block.text: <<Hirodiyanı almaq sәnә qadağandır>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Herod wanted to kill John but he was afraid of the people because they considered John to be a prophet.

block.text: Hirod Yәhyanı öldürmәk istәyirdi, amma camaatdan qorxurdu. Çünki camaat Yәhyanı peyğәmbәr sayırdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when Herod’s birthday came, the daughter of Herodias danced among them and pleased Herod.
Then he promised her with an oath:

block.text: Hirodun ad günü qeyd edilәndә Hirodiyanın qızı ortaya çıxıb rәqs etmәyә başladı. Bu, Hirodun xoşuna gәldi.
Sonra and ona və'd:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I will give you whatever you ask for!”

block.text: "Mən sizə hər hansı sizin üçün xahiş verəcəkdir!"

ReferenceBlocks.text: She, being prompted by her mother, said,

block.text: Qız isә anasının tәhriki ilә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Give me here on a platter the head of John the Baptizer.”

block.text: <<Vәftizçi Yәhyanın başını burada bir sini içindә mәnә ver>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The king was grieved, but for the sake of his oaths, and of those who sat at the table with him, he commanded that her request be granted.

block.text: Padşahı kәdәr bürüdü, amma içdiyi andlara vә qonaqlara görә әmr etdi ki, ona istәdiyini versinlәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He sent and beheaded John in the prison.

block.text: Belәliklә, zindanda Yәhyanın boynunu vurdurdu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: His head was brought on a platter, and given to the young lady: and she brought it to her mother.

block.text: Onun başı bir sini içindә gәtirilib qıza verildi. Qız da anasına apardı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: His disciples came, and took the body, and buried it; and they went and told Jesus.

block.text: Yәhyanın şagirdlәri gәlib onun cәsәdini götürdülәr. Onu basdırdılar vә gәlib İsaya bu barәdә xәbәr verdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now when Jesus heard this, he withdrew from there in a boat, to a deserted place apart. When the multitudes heard it, they followed him on foot from the cities.

block.text: İsa bunu eşidib qayığa minәrәk tәkbaşına oradan kimsәsiz bir yerә çәkildi. Bunu eşidәn camaat şәhәrlәrdәn piyada Onun ardınca getdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus went out, and he saw a great multitude. He had compassion on them, and healed their sick.

block.text: İsa sahilә düşәndә böyük bir izdiham gördü, onlara rәhmi gәldi vә xәstәlәrinә şәfa verdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When evening had come, his disciples came to him, saying,

block.text: Axşama yaxın şagirdlәr Onun yanına gәlib dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This place is deserted, and the hour is already late. Send the multitudes away, that they may go into the villages, and buy themselves food.”

block.text: <<Bura çöllükdür, vaxt da gecdir. Camaatı burax, qoy gedib kәndlәrdәn özlәrinә yemәk alsın>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Jesus said to them,

block.text: Amma İsa onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “They don’t need to go away. You give them something to eat.”

block.text: <<Getmәklәrinә ehtiyac yoxdur. Onlara yemәyi siz verin>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They told him,

block.text: Şagirdlәr İsaya dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We only have here five loaves and two fish.”

block.text: <<Burada beş çörәk vә iki balıqdan başqa bir şeyimiz yoxdur>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: İsa dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Bring them here to me.”

block.text: <<onları buraya, Mәnә gәtirin>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He commanded the multitudes to sit down on the grass; and he took the five loaves and the two fish, and looking up to heaven, he blessed, broke and gave the loaves to the disciples, and the disciples gave to the multitudes.

block.text: Camaata әmr etdi ki, otların üstündә otursunlar. İsa beş çörәyi vә iki balığı götürüb göyә baxaraq şükür duası etdi. Sonra çörәyi bölüb şagirdlәrә verdi. Şagirdlәr dә camaata payladı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They all ate, and were filled. They took up twelve baskets full of that which remained left over from the broken pieces.

block.text: Hamı yeyib-doydu. Artıq qalan hissәlәrdәn on iki dolu zәnbil yığdılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those who ate were about five thousand men, besides women and children.

block.text: Yemәk yeyәn adamların sayı qadınlar vә uşaqlardan başqa, beş min nәfәrә yaxın idi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately Jesus made the disciples get into the boat, and to go ahead of him to the other side, while he sent the multitudes away.

block.text: Bundan dәrhal sonra İsa camaatı evlәrinә göndәrәrkәn şagirdlәrinә dә qayığa minib Özündәn әvvәl o biri sahilә keçmәlәrini mәcbur etdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: After he had sent the multitudes away, he went up into the mountain by himself to pray. When evening had come, he was there alone.

block.text: İsa camaatı göndәrәndәn sonra dua etmәk üçün tәk-tәnha dağa çıxdı. Axşam olanda orada tәk idi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the boat was now in the middle of the sea, distressed by the waves, for the wind was contrary.

block.text: Qayıq isә artıq qurudan çox stadi uzaqda idi vә külәk onlara qarşı olduğundan dalğalar qayığa zәrbәlәr endirirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In the fourth watch of the night, Jesus came to them, walking on the sea.

block.text: Gecәnin dördüncü növbәsi İsa gölün üstü ilә yeriyәrәk onların yanına gәldi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the disciples saw him walking on the sea, they were troubled, saying,

block.text: Şagirdlәr isә İsanın gölün üstü ilә yeridiyini görәndә

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It’s a ghost!”

block.text: <<Bu bir kabusdur!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: and they cried in fear.
But immediately Jesus spoke to them, saying

block.text: deyәrәk lәrzәyә düşdülәr vә qorxudan qışqırdılar.
Lakin bu anda İsa onlara müraciәt edib dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Cheer up! It is I! Don’t be afraid.”

block.text: <<Cәsarәtli olun, Mәnәm, qorxmayın!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter answered him and said,

block.text: Peter cavabında Ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, if it is you, command me to come to you on the waters.”

block.text: <<Ya Rәbb, әgәr Sәnsәnsә, mәnә әmr et ki, suların üstü ilә yanına gәlim>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: İsa dedi,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Come!”
Peter stepped down from the boat, and walked on the waters to come to Jesus.

block.text: Peter dә qayıqdan çıxıb suların üstü ilә yeridi vә İsaya tәrәf getdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when he saw that the wind was strong, he was afraid, and beginning to sink, he cried out, saying,

block.text: Amma külәyin güclü әsdiyini görәndә qorxdu vә batmağa başladı. deyә qışqırdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, save me!”

block.text: <<Ya Rәbb, mәni xilas et!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately Jesus stretched out his hand, took hold of him, and said to him,

block.text: İsa o anda әlini uzadıb onu tutdu vә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You of little faith, why did you doubt?”

block.text: <<Ey imanı az olan adam, nә üçün şübhә etdin?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they got up into the boat, the wind ceased.

block.text: Onlar qayığa mindiklәri zaman külәk sakitlәşdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those who were in the boat came and worshiped him, saying,

block.text: Qayıqda olanlar deyә Ona sәcdә qıldılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You are truly the Son of God!”

block.text: <<Doğrudan da, Sәn Allahın Oğlusan!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had crossed over, they came to the land of Gennesaret.

block.text: İsa vә şagirdlәr gölü keçib Ginesar sahilinә çatdılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the people of that place recognized him, they sent into all that surrounding region, and brought to him all who were sick.

block.text: O yerin adamları İsanı tanıdıqları zaman әtrafdakı hәr yerә xәbәr yaydılar. Bütün xәstәlәri Onun yanına gәtirdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They begged him that they might just touch the fringe of his garment. As many as touched it were made whole.

block.text: Xәstәlәr heç olmasa İsanın paltarının әtәyinә toxunmaq üçün yalvarırdılar. Ona toxunanların hamısı sağaldı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW 15
Then Pharisees and scribes came to Jesus from Jerusalem, saying,

block.text: Onda Yerusәlimdәn fariseylәr vә ilahiyyatçılar İsanın yanına gәlib dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why do your disciples disobey the tradition of the elders? For they don’t wash their hands when they eat bread.”

block.text: <<Nә üçün şagirdlәrin ağsaqqallardan qalan adәt-әnәnәni pozur vә çörәk yediklәri zaman әllәrini yumurlar?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He answered them,

block.text: İsa cavabında onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why do you also disobey the commandment of God because of your tradition?

block.text: <<Bәs siz nә üçün öz adәt-әnәnәniz naminә Allahın әmrini pozursunuz?

ReferenceBlocks.text: For God commanded, ‘Honor your father and your mother,’ and, ‘He who speaks evil of father or mother, let him be put to death.’

block.text: Çünki Allah belә әmr etdi: “Ata-anana hörmәt et” vә “Atasını yaxud anasını söyәn adam öldürülmәlidir”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But you say, ‘Whoever may tell his father or his mother, “Whatever help you might otherwise have gotten from me is a gift devoted to God,”

block.text: Siz isә deyirsiniz: “Kim atasına yaxud anasına ‹mәndәn umduğun yardım Allaha hәsr olundu› desә,

ReferenceBlocks.text: he shall not honor his father or mother.’ You have made the commandment of God void because of your tradition.”

block.text: onda atasına hörmәt etmәyә bilәr”. Belәliklә, siz öz adәt-әnәnәniz naminә Allahın kәlamını heç edirsiniz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You hypocrites! Well did Isaiah prophesy of you, saying,

block.text: Ey ikiüzlülәr! Yeşaya peyğәmbәr sizin üçün nә yaxşı söylәyib! O demişdir:

ReferenceBlocks.text: ‘These people draw near to me with their mouth, and honor me with their lips; but their heart is far from me.

block.text: “Bu xalq dodaqları ilә Mәnә hörmәt edir, Amma qәlblәri Mәndәn uzaqdır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: And in vain do they worship me, teaching as doctrine rules made by men.’”

block.text: Boş yerә Mәnә sәcdә edirlәr, İnsan әmrlәrindәn çıxardıqları tәlimlәri öyrәdirlәr”>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He summoned the multitude, and said to them,

block.text: İsa camaatı yanına çağırıb onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Hear, and understand.
That which enters into the mouth doesn’t defile the man; but that which proceeds out of the mouth, this defiles the man.”

block.text: <<Qulaq asın vә dәrk edin.
Ağıza daxil olan şey insanı murdar etmәz, amma insanı murdar edәn ağızdan çıxan şeydir>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then the disciples came, and said to him,

block.text: O zaman şagirdlәr gәlib Ona dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do you know that the Pharisees were offended, when they heard this saying?”

block.text: <<Bilirsәnmi fariseylәr bu sözü eşitdikdә incidilәr>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he answered,

block.text: Amma İsa cavab verib dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Every plant which my heavenly Father didn’t plant will be uprooted.

block.text: <<Sәmavi Atamın әkmәdiyi hәr bitki kökündәn qoparılacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Leave them alone. They are blind guides of the blind. If the blind guide the blind, both will fall into a pit.”

block.text: Onları buraxın. Onlar korların kor rәhbәrlәridir. Әgәr kor koru aparsa, ikisi dә çuxura düşәr>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter answered him,

block.text: Peter Ona cavab verәrәk dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Explain the parable to us.”

block.text: <<Bu mәsәli bizә izah et>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So Jesus said,

block.text: İsa dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do you also still not understand?

block.text: <<Siz dә hәlә dәrk etmәmisiniz?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Don’t you see that whatever goes into the mouth passes into the belly, and then out of the body?

block.text: Başa düşmürsünüz ki, ağıza girәn hәr şey qarına gedir vә ifraz olunur?

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the things which proceed out of the mouth come out of the heart, and they defile the man.

block.text: Ağızdan çıxan şeylәr isә ürәkdәn çıxar, bunlar da insanı murdar edәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For out of the heart come forth evil thoughts, murders, adulteries, sexual sins, thefts, false testimony, and blasphemies.

block.text: Çünki ürәkdәn pis fikirlәr, qatillik, zinakarlıq, cinsi әxlaqsızlıq, oğurluq, yalançı şahidlik vә küfr çıxar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: These are the things which defile the man; but to eat with unwashed hands doesn’t defile the man.”

block.text: İnsanı murdar edәn şeylәr bunlardır. Yuyulmamış әllәrlә yemәk isә insanı murdar etmәz>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus went out from there, and withdrew into the region of Tyre and Sidon.

block.text: İsa oradan çıxıb Sur vә Sidon bölgәlәrinә çәkildi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, a Canaanite woman came out from those borders, and crying out she said,

block.text: Budur, Kәnanlı bir qadın o diyardan çıxıb

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Have mercy on me, Lord, you son of David! My daughter is severely demonized!”

block.text: <<ya Rәbb, ey Davud Oğlu, mәnә rәhm elә. Qızım ağır bir halda cinә tutulmuşdur>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he answered her not a word. His disciples came and begged him, saying,

block.text: İsa cavabında ona bir söz belә, demәdi. Şagirdlәri yaxınlaşıb deyәrәk İsaya yalvardılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Send her away; for she cries out after us.”

block.text: <<onu burax, çünki arxamızca çığırır>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he answered,

block.text: Amma İsa cavab verib dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I wasn’t sent to anyone but the lost sheep of the house of Israel.”

block.text: <<Mәn yalnız İsrail xalqının itmiş qoyunlarının yanına göndәrilmişәm>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But she came and worshiped him, saying,

block.text: Qadın isә yaxınlaşdı vә Ona sәcdә qılıb dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, help me.”

block.text: <<Ya Rәbb, mәnә imdad et>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he answered,

block.text: İsa cavab verib dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It is not appropriate to take the children’s bread and throw it to the dogs.”

block.text: <<Uşaqların çörәyini götürüb itlәrә atmaq düzgün olmaz>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But she said,

block.text: Qadın dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Yes, Lord, but even the dogs eat the crumbs which fall from their masters’ table.”

block.text: <<Haqlısan, ya Rәbb! Amma itlәr dә sahiblәrinin süfrәsindәn düşәn qırıntılardan yeyir>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then Jesus answered her,

block.text: O zaman İsa cavab verib qadına dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Woman, great is your faith! Be it done to you even as you desire.”

block.text: <<Ey qadın! İmanın böyükdür; sәnә istәdiyin kimi olsun>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: And her daughter was healed from that hour.

block.text: Onun qızı o saatda sağaldı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus departed there, and came near to the sea of Galilee; and he went up into the mountain, and sat there.

block.text: İsa oradan çıxıb Qalileya gölünün sahilindәn keçdi vә dağın başına çıxıb orada oturdu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Great multitudes came to him, having with them the lame, blind, mute, maimed, and many others, and they put them down at his feet and he healed them.

block.text: Onun yanına böyük bir izdiham gәldi vә özlәri ilә birlikdә topallar, korlar, şikәstlәr, lallar vә daha başqa bir çoxunu gәtirdilәr. Onları İsanın ayaqları yanına qoydular vә İsa onlara şәfa verdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The people were amazed when they saw the mute speaking, injured whole, lame walking, and blind seeing--and they glorified the God of Israel.

block.text: Xalq görәndә ki lallar danışır, şikәstlәr sağalır, topallar yeriyir vә korlar görür, heyrәtlәndi vә İsrailin Allahını izzәtlәndirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus summoned his disciples and said,

block.text: İsa şagirdlәrini yanına çağırıb dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I have compassion on the multitude, because they continue with me now three days and have nothing to eat. I don’t want to send them away fasting, or they might faint on the way.”

block.text: <<Bu camaata yazığım gәlir, çünki üç gündür ki, yanımdadırlar vә yemәyә heç nәlәri yoxdur. Onları evlәrinә ac yola salmaq istәmirәm ki, yolda taqәtdәn düşmәsinlәr>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The disciples said to him,

block.text: Şagirdlәr Ona dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Where should we get so many loaves in a deserted place as to satisfy so great a multitude?”

block.text: <<Bu çöllükdә bu qәdәr camaatı doydurmaq üçün çörәyi haradan tapaq?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to them,

block.text: İsa onlardan soruşdu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “How many loaves do you have?”

block.text: <<Neçә çörәyiniz var?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said,

block.text: Onlar dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Seven, and a few small fish.”

block.text: <<Yeddi vә bir az da kiçik balığımız var>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He commanded the people, saying:

block.text: O, belə insanlar əmr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Sit down on the ground.”

block.text: "Əsasında aşağı Sit."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He took the seven loaves and the fish. He gave thanks and broke them, and gave to the disciples, and the disciples to the multitudes.

block.text: Yeddi çörәklә balıqları götürdü vә şükür edәrәk bölüb şagirdlәrә, şagirdlәr dә camaata verdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They all ate, and were filled. They took up seven baskets full of the broken pieces that were left over.

block.text: Hamı yeyib-doydu. Artıq qalan hissәlәri yığdılar, yeddi sәbәt doldu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those who ate were four thousand men, besides women and children.

block.text: Yemәk yeyәn adamların sayı isә qadınlar vә uşaqlardan başqa, dörd min nәfәr idi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he sent away the multitudes, got into the boat, and came into the borders of Magdala.

block.text: İsa camaatı buraxıb qayığa minәrәk Mәcdәl bölgәsinә getdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW 16
The Pharisees and Sadducees came to test him and said,

block.text: Fariseylәr vә sadukeylәr ona sınamaq gəlib dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Show us a sign from Heaven.”

block.text: "Bizə göydən bir mö'cüzə göstərin."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he answered them,

block.text: Amma İsa onlara cavab verdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “When it is evening, you say, ‘It will be fair weather, for the sky is red.’

block.text: <<Axşam olanda siz deyirsiniz: “Hava yaxşı olacaq, çünki göy qırmızıdır”,

ReferenceBlocks.text: In the morning, ‘It will be foul weather today, for the sky is red and threatening.’ Hypocrites! You know how to discern the appearance of the sky, but you can’t discern the signs of the times!

block.text: sәhәr çağı “bu gün fırtına qopacaq, çünki göy qırmızıdır, tutqundur” deyirsiniz. Göyün görünüşünü seçә bilirsiniz, ancaq zamanın әlamәtlәrini seçә bilmirsiniz?

ReferenceBlocks.text: An evil and adulterous generation seeks after a sign, and there will be no sign given to it, except the sign of the prophet Jonah.”

block.text: Pis vә vәfasız nәsil bir әlamәt axtarır. Amma ona Yunusun әlamәtindәn başqa heç bir әlamәt verilmәyәcәk>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He left them, and departed.

block.text: İsa onları tәrk edib getdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The disciples came to the other side and had forgotten to take bread.
Jesus said to them,

block.text: Şagirdlәr o taya keçәndә çörәk götürmәyi yaddan çıxarmışdılar.
İsa onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Take heed and beware of the yeast of the Pharisees and Sadducees.”

block.text: <<Ehtiyatlı olun! Fariseylәrin vә sadukeylәrin mayasından özünüzü gözlәyin>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They reasoned among themselves, saying,

block.text: Şagirdlәr isә öz aralarında danışıb deyirdilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We brought no bread.”

block.text: <<Bunu çörәk götürmәdiyimiz üçün deyir>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus, perceiving it, said,

block.text: İsa bunu bilәrәk dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why do you reason among yourselves, you of little faith, ‘because you have brought no bread?’

block.text: <<Ey imanı az olanlar! Nә üçün çörәyinizin yoxluğundan danışırsınız?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Don’t you yet not understand nor remember the five loaves for the five thousand, and how many baskets you took up?

block.text: Hәlә dәrk etmirsinizmi? Beş min nәfәr üçün beş çörәyi vә neçә zәnbil yığdığınızı xatırlamırsınızmı?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Nor the seven loaves for the four thousand, and how many baskets you took up?

block.text: Dörd min nәfәr üçün yeddi çörәyi vә neçә sәbәt yığdığınızı da xatırlamırsınızmı?

ReferenceBlocks.text: How is it that you don’t perceive that I didn’t speak to you concerning bread? But beware of the yeast of the Pharisees and Sadducees.”

block.text: Necә anlaya bilmirsiniz ki, Mәn sizinlә danışanda çörәyi nәzәrdә tutmamışdım? Fariseylәrin vә sadukeylәrin mayasından özünüzü gözlәyin>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then they understood that he didn’t tell them to beware of the yeast of bread, but of the teaching of the Pharisees and Sadducees.

block.text: O zaman onlar anladılar ki, İsa çörәk mayasından yox, fariseylәrin vә sadukeylәrin tәlimindәn qorunmağı nәzәrdә tutmuşdu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now when Jesus came into the parts of Caesarea Philippi, he asked his disciples, saying,

block.text: İsa Filip Qeysәriyyәsi bölgәsinә gәldiyi zaman Öz şagirdlәrindәn soruşdu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who do men say that I, the Son of Man, am?”

block.text: <<Adamların dediyinә görә Bәşәr Oğlu kimdir?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said,

block.text: Onlar da dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Some say John the Baptizer, some, Elijah, and others, Jeremiah, or one of the prophets.”

block.text: <<Bәzilәri Vәftizçi Yәhya, başqaları İlyas, digәrlәri isә deyirlәr ki, Yeremya yaxud peyğәmbәrlәrdәn biridir>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: İsa onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “But who do you say that I am?”

block.text: <<Bәs siz nә deyirsiniz? Sizcә Mәn kimәm?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Simon Peter answered,

block.text: Şimon Peter cavab verdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You are the Christ, the Son of the living God.”

block.text: <<Sәn var olan Allahın Oğlu Mәsihsәn>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered him,

block.text: İsa ona cavab verib dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Blessed are you, Simon Bar Jonah, for flesh and blood has not revealed this to you, but my Father who is in heaven.

block.text: <<Nә bәxtiyarsan, ey Yunus oğlu Şimon! Çünki bunu sәnә bildirәn әt vә qan deyil, göylәrdә olan Atamdır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I also tell you that you are Peter, and on this rock I will build my assembly, and the gates of Hades will not prevail against it.

block.text: Mәn sәnә deyirәm ki, sәn Petersәn vә Mәn cәmiyyәtimi bu Qayanın üzәrindә quracağam. Ölülәr diyarının qapıları ona qalib gәlә bilmәyәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I will give to you the keys of the Kingdom of Heaven, and whatever you bind on earth will have been bound in heaven; and whatever you release on earth will have been released in heaven.”

block.text: Sәmavi Padşahlığın açarlarını sәnә verәcәyәm. Yer üzündә bağlayacağın hәr şey göylәrdә bağlanmış olacaq vә yer üzündә açacağın hәr şey göylәrdә açılmış olacaq>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he commanded the disciples that they should tell no one that he was Jesus the Christ.

block.text: Bu sözlәrdәn sonra İsa şagirdlәrә qadağan etdi ki, Onun Mәsih olduğunu heç kәsә danışmasınlar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: From that time, Jesus began to show his disciples that he must go to Jerusalem and suffer many things from the elders, chief priests, and scribes, and be killed, and the third day be raised up.

block.text: Bundan sonra İsa şagirdlәrinә danışmağa başladı ki, Özü Yerusәlimә getmәli, ağsaqqallar, başçı kahinlәr vә ilahiyyatçılar tәrәfindәn çox әzab çәkmәli, öldürülmәli vә üçüncü gün dirilmәlidir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter took him aside, and began to rebuke him, saying,

block.text: Peter Onu bir kәnara çәkib etiraz etmәyә başladı:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Far be it from you, Lord! This will never be done to you.”

block.text: <<Ya Rәbb, Özünә yazığın gәlsin! Bu әsla Sәnin başına gәlmәyәcәk!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he turned, and said to Peter,

block.text: Amma İsa dönüb Peterә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Get behind me, Satan! You are a stumbling block to me, for you are not setting your mind on the things of God, but on the things of men.”

block.text: <<Çәkil qarşımdan, Şeytan! Sәn Mәnә mane olursan. Sәn Allahın işlәri haqqında deyil, insan әmәllәri barәsindә fikirlәşirsәn>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then Jesus said to his disciples,

block.text: Sonra İsa şagirdlәrinә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If anyone desires to come after me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross, and follow me.

block.text: <<Әgәr bir kәs Mәnim ardımca gәlmәk istәyirsә, özündәn imtina etsin vә çarmıxını götürüb ardımca gәlsin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For whoever desires to save his life will lose it, and whoever will lose his life for my sake will find it.

block.text: Kim canını xilas etmәk istәyirsә, onu itirәcәk, amma kim Mәnә görә canını itirirsә, onu qoruyacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For what will it profit a man, if he gains the whole world, and forfeits his life? Or what will a man give in exchange for his life?

block.text: İnsan bütün dünyanı qazanıb canını itirәrsә, ona nә xeyri var? Yaxud insan öz canının әvәzinә nә verә bilәr?

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the Son of Man will come in the glory of his Father with his angels, and then he will render to everyone according to his deeds.

block.text: Çünki Bәşәr Oğlu Atasının izzәti içindә Öz mәlәklәri ilә gәlәcәk vә o zaman hәr kәsә öz әmәlinә görә әvәzini verәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Most certainly I tell you, there are some standing here who will in no way taste of death, until they see the Son of Man coming in his Kingdom.”

block.text: Sizә doğrusunu deyirәm: burada duranlardan bәzisi Bәşәr Oğlunun Padşahlığı ilә gәldiyini görmәdәn ölmәyәcәk>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW 17
After six days, Jesus took with him Peter, James, and John his brother, and brought them up into a high mountain by themselves.

block.text: Altı gündәn sonra İsa Özü ilә yalnız Peter, Yaqub vә qardaşı Yәhyanı götürüb hündür bir dağa çıxdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He was transfigured before them. His face shone like the sun, and his garments became as white as the light.

block.text: Onların qarşısında görünüşü dәyişdi. Üzü günәş kimi parladı vә libası işıq kimi ağ oldu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, Moses and Elijah appeared to them talking with him.

block.text: O an Musa vә İlyas onlara göründü. Onlar İsa ilә söhbәt edirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter answered, and said to Jesus,

block.text: Peter sözә başlayıb İsaya dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, it is good for us to be here. If you want, let’s make three tents here: one for you, one for Moses, and one for Elijah.”

block.text: <<Ya Rәbb! Nә yaxşı ki biz buradayıq. Әgәr istәyirsәnsә, burada üç çardaq qurum – biri Sәnin, biri Musa, biri dә İlyas üçün>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: While he was still speaking, behold, a bright cloud overshadowed them. Behold, a voice came out of the cloud, saying,

block.text: Peter hәlә danışan zaman parlaq bir bulud onların üzәrinә kölgә saldı. Budur, buluddan bir sәs gәldi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased. Listen to him.”

block.text: <<Bu Mәnim sevimli Oğlumdur, Ondan razıyam, Ona qulaq asın!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the disciples heard it, they fell on their faces, and were very afraid.

block.text: Şagirdlәr bunu eşidәndә üzüstә yerә qapandılar vә onları böyük dәhşәt bürüdü.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus came and touched them, saying:

block.text: İsa gәlib onlara toxunaraq dedi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Get up, and don’t be afraid.”

block.text: <<Qalxın, qorxmayın!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Lifting up their eyes, they saw no one, except Jesus alone.

block.text: Onlar da başını qaldıranda İsadan başqa kimsәni görmәdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As they were coming down from the mountain, Jesus commanded them, saying,

block.text: Dağdan enәrkәn İsa şagirdlәrinә әmr etdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Don’t tell anyone what you saw, until the Son of Man has risen from the dead.”

block.text: <<Bәşәr Oğlu ölülәr arasından dirilәnә qәdәr gördüyünüzü heç kimә söylәmәyin>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: His disciples asked him, saying,

block.text: Şagirdlәr Ondan soruşdu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Then why do the scribes say that Elijah must come first?”

block.text: <<Elә isә, niyә ilahiyyatçılar deyirlәr ki, әvvәlcә İlyas gәlmәlidir?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered them,

block.text: İsa onlara cavab verdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Elijah indeed comes first, and will restore all things.

block.text: <<Düzdür, İlyas gәlib hәr şeyi yoluna qoymalıdır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But I tell you that Elijah has come already, and they didn’t recognize him, but did to him whatever they wanted to. Even so the Son of Man will also suffer by them.”

block.text: Lakin sizә deyirәm: artıq İlyas gәldi vә onu tanımadılar, lakin nә istәdilәrsә, onun başına gәtirdilәr. Eyni cür Bәşәr Oğlu da onların әlindәn әzab çәkәcәk>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then the disciples understood that he spoke to them of John the Baptizer.

block.text: Şagirdlәr o zaman başa düşdülәr ki, İsa onlara bu sözlәri Vәftizçi Yәhya haqqında söylәyirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they came to the multitude, a man came to him, kneeling down to him, saying,

block.text: Onlar xalqın yanına gәlәndә bir adam gәlib İsanın qarşısında diz çökәrәk dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, have mercy on my son, for he is epileptic, and suffers grievously; for he often falls into the fire, and often into the water.

block.text: <<Ya Rәbb! Oğluma rәhm elә, çünki o, epileptikdir vә çox әzab çәkir. Tez-tez gah oda, gah da suya düşür.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So I brought him to your disciples, and they could not cure him.”

block.text: Onu Sәnin şagirdlәrinin yanına gәtirdim, lakin ona şәfa verә bilmәdilәr>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered,

block.text: İsa cavab verәrәk dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Faithless and perverse generation! How long will I be with you? How long will I bear with you? Bring him here to me.”

block.text: <<Ey imansız vә yolunu azmış nәsil! Nә vaxta qәdәr sizinlә olacağam? Nә vaxta qәdәr sizә dözәcәyәm? Uşağı buraya, yanıma gәtirin>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus rebuked him, the demon went out
of him, and the boy was cured from that hour.

block.text: İsa cinә qadağan etdi vә cin uşaqdan çıxdı.
Oğlan o saatda şәfa tapdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then the disciples came to Jesus privately, and said,

block.text: O zaman şagirdlәr İsaya tәklikdә yaxınlaşıb dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why weren’t we able to cast it out?”

block.text: <<Nә üçün biz o ruhu qova bilmәdik?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: İsa da onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Because of your unbelief. For most certainly I tell you, if you have faith as a grain of mustard seed, you will tell this mountain, ‘Move from here to there,’ and it will move; and nothing will be impossible for you.

block.text: <<İmanınız az olduğu üçün. Çünki sizә doğrusunu deyirәm: bir xardal toxumu qәdәr imanınız olarsa vә siz bu dağa “buradan oraya köç” desәniz, o köçәr vә sizin üçün mümkün olmayan heç bir şey olmaz>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But this kind doesn’t go out except by prayer and fasting.”

block.text: But this kind only goes out by prayer and fasting.

ReferenceBlocks.text: While they were staying in Galilee, Jesus said to them,

block.text: Qalileyada yığılarkәn İsa şagirdlәrә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The Son of Man is about to be delivered up into the hands of men,
and they will kill him, and the third day he will be raised up.”

block.text: <<Bәşәr Oğlu insan әllәrinә tәslim edilәcәk
vә Onu öldürәcәklәr, amma O, üçüncü gün dirilәcәk>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were exceedingly sorry.

block.text: Onlar çox kәdәrlәndilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had come to Capernaum, those who collected the didrachma coins came to Peter, and said,

block.text: Kefernahuma gәldiklәri zaman mәbәd vergisini yığanlar Peterә yaxınlaşıb dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Doesn’t your teacher pay the temple tax?”

block.text: <<Sizin Müәlliminiz vergi ödәmirmi?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Peter dedi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Yes.”

block.text: <<ödәyir>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he came into the house, Jesus anticipated him, saying,

block.text: Evә gәlәndә İsa onu qabaqlayaraq dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What do you think, Simon? From whom do the kings of the earth receive toll or tribute? From their children, or from strangers?”

block.text: <<Şimon! Sәn necә düşünürsәn? Yerin hökmdarları gömrük vә yaxud vergini kimdәn alırlar? Öz övladlarındanmı, yoxsa kәnar adamlardan?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter said to him,

block.text: Peter Ona dedi,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “From strangers.”

block.text: <<kәnar adamlardan>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: İsa ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Therefore the children are exempt.

block.text: <<Belә isә, övladlar sәrbәstdir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But, lest we cause them to stumble, go to the sea, cast a hook, and take up the first fish that comes up. When you have opened its mouth, you will find a four Drachma coin. Take that, and give it to them for me and you.”

block.text: Lakin bu adamları incitmәyәk deyә gölә get, tilov at vә tilova düşәn ilk balığı götür. Onun ağzını açanda bir gümüş pul tapacaqsan. Onu götür, hәm Mәnim, hәm dә öz әvәzinә ver>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW 18
In that hour the disciples came to Jesus, saying,

block.text: Hәmin vaxt şagirdlәr İsanın yanına gәlib dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who then is greatest in the Kingdom of Heaven?”

block.text: <<Sәmavi Padşahlıqda әn böyük kimdir?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus called a little child to himself, and set him in their midst,
and said,

block.text: İsa yanına bir balaca uşaq çağırıb onu şagirdlәrin arasına qoydu.
O dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Most certainly I tell you, unless you turn, and become as little children, you will in no way enter into the Kingdom of Heaven.

block.text: <<Sizә doğrusunu deyirәm: әgәr siz yolunuzdan dönüb uşaqlar kimi olmasanız, Sәmavi Padşahlığa әsla daxil ola bilmәzsiniz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Whoever therefore humbles himself as this little child, the same is the greatest in the Kingdom of Heaven.

block.text: Belәliklә, kim bu uşaq kimi özünü aşağı tutarsa, Sәmavi Padşahlıqda әn böyük odur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Whoever receives one such little child in my name receives me,

block.text: Kim Mәnim adımla belә bir uşağı qәbul edәrsә, Mәni qәbul edәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: but whoever causes one of these little ones who believe in me to stumble, it would be better for him that a huge millstone should be hung around his neck, and that he should be sunk in the depths of the sea.”

block.text: Amma kim Mәnә iman edәn bu kiçiklәrdәn birini pis yola çәkәrsә, öz boynuna böyük bir dәyirman daşı asıb dәnizin dibinә atılaraq boğulmaq onun üçün daha yaxşı olar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Woe to the world because of occasions of stumbling! For it must be that the occasions come, but woe to that person through whom the occasion comes!

block.text: İnsanları pis yola çәkәn şeylәr üçün vay bu dünyanın halına! Belә şeylәrin gәlmәsi qarşısıalınmazdır, amma vay o adamın halına ki, bunlar onun vasitәsilә gәlir!

ReferenceBlocks.text: If your hand or your foot causes you to stumble, cut it off, and cast it from you. It is better for you to enter into life maimed or crippled, rather than having two hands or two feet to be cast into the eternal fire.

block.text: Әgәr әlin vә ya ayağın sәni pis yola çәkәrsә, onu kәs at. Sәnin әbәdi hәyata şikәst vә ya topal daxil olmağın iki әl vә iki ayaqla әbәdi oda atılmağından yaxşıdır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If your eye causes you to stumble, pluck it out, and cast it from you. It is better for you to enter into life with one eye, rather than having two eyes to be cast into the Gehenna of fire.

block.text: Әgәr gözün sәni pis yola çәkәrsә, onu çıxart at. Sәnin tәk gözlә әbәdi hәyata daxil olmağın iki gözlә cәhәnnәm oduna atılmağından yaxşıdır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: See that you don’t despise one of these little ones, for I tell you that in heaven their angels always see the face of my Father who is in heaven.

block.text: Bu kiçiklәrdәn birinә belә, xor baxmaqdan çәkinin. Çünki sizә deyirәm: onların sәmadakı mәlәklәri göylәrdә olan Atamın üzünü daima görür.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the Son of Man came to save that which was lost.”

block.text: For the son of Man came to save that which was lost.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What do you think? If a man has one hundred sheep, and one of them goes astray, doesn’t he leave the ninety-nine, go to the mountains, and seek that which has gone astray?

block.text: Siz necә deyirsiniz? Bir adamın yüz qoyunu varsa vә onlardan biri yolunu azarsa, doxsan doqquzunu dağlarda qoyub yolunu azan qoyunu axtarmağa getmәzmi?

ReferenceBlocks.text: If he finds it, most certainly I tell you, he rejoices over it more than over the ninety-nine which have not gone astray.

block.text: Sizә doğrusunu deyirәm: әgәr onu tapa bilәrsә, yolunu azmayan doxsan doqquz qoyun üçün sevindiyindәn artıq onun üçün sevinәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Even so it is not the will of your Father who is in heaven that one of these little ones should perish.”

block.text: Belәcә bu kiçiklәrdәn birinin belә, hәlak olması göylәrdә olan Atanızın iradәsi deyil.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If your brother sins against you, go, show him his fault between you and him alone. If he listens to you, you have gained back your brother.

block.text: Әgәr qardaşın sәnә qarşı günah işlәdәrsә, get, onun günahını ona göstәr. Qoy hәr şey yalnız ikinizin arasında qalsın. O sәnә qulaq asarsa, qardaşını qazandın.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But if he doesn’t listen, take one or two more with you, that at the mouth of two or three witnesses every word may be established.

block.text: Amma qulaq asmazsa, özünlә bir vә ya iki nәfәr götür ki, “Hәr iddia iki yaxud üç şahidin sözü ilә tәsdiq edilsin”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If he refuses to listen to them, tell it to the assembly. If he refuses to hear the assembly also, let him be to you as a Gentile or a tax collector.

block.text: Әgәr o bu adamların da sözünә qulaq asmaq istәmәsә, vәziyyәti imanlılar cәmiyyәtinә bildir. Әgәr cәmiyyәtin dә sözünә qulaq asmaq istәmәsә, onu bir bütpәrәst vә vergiyığan hesab et.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Most certainly I tell you, whatever things you bind on earth will have been bound in heaven, and whatever things you release on earth will have been released in heaven.

block.text: Sizә doğrusunu deyirәm: yer üzündә bağlayacağınız hәr şey göydә bağlanmış olacaq vә yer üzündә açacağınız hәr şey göydә açılmış olacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Again, assuredly I tell you, that if two of you will agree on earth concerning anything that they will ask, it will be done for them by my Father who is in heaven.

block.text: Yenә sizә doğrusunu deyirәm: yer üzündә sizlәrdәn iki nәfәr dilәyәcәklәri hәr hansı bir şey üçün razılığa gәlәrsә, göylәrdә olan Atam onların istәklәrini yerinә yetirәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For where two or three are gathered together in my name, there I am in their midst.”
