block.text: Çünki harada iki vә ya üç nәfәr Mәnim adımla yığılarsa, Mәn dә orada, onların arasındayam>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then Peter came and said to him,

block.text: O zaman Peter gәlib İsaya dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, how often shall my brother sin against me, and I forgive him? Until seven times?”

block.text: <<Ya Rәbb! Qardaşım mәnә qarşı günah işlәdәrsә, neçә dәfә mәn onu bağışlamalıyam? Yeddi dәfәmi?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: İsa ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I tell you, not seven times, but, seventy times seven.

block.text: <<Sәnә deyirәm: yeddi dәfә yox, yetmiş dәfә yeddi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore the Kingdom of Heaven is like a certain king, who wanted to reconcile accounts with his servants.

block.text: Ona görә dә Sәmavi Padşahlıq öz qulları ilә hesablaşmaq istәyәn bir padşaha bәnzәyir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had begun to reconcile, one was brought to him who owed him ten thousand talents.

block.text: Hesablaşmağa başladığı zaman onun yanına on min talant borcu olan biri gәtirildi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But because he couldn’t pay, his lord commanded him to be sold, with his wife, his children, and all that he had, and payment to be made.

block.text: Amma onun ödәmәyә bir şeyi olmadığı üçün ağası әmr etdi ki, özü, arvadı, uşaqları vә bütün malı satılaraq borcunu ödәsin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The servant therefore fell down and worshipped him before him, saying, ‘Lord, have patience with me, and I will repay you all!’

block.text: Elә bu vaxt qul yerә qapanıb ona sәcdә edәrәk dedi: “Sәbir et! Mәn hamısını ödәyәcәyәm”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The lord of that servant, being moved with compassion, released him, and forgave him the debt.”

block.text: Ağasının o qula rәhmi gәldi, onu buraxdı vә borcunu bağışladı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “But that servant went out, and found one of his fellow servants, who owed him one hundred denarii, and he grabbed him, and took him by the throat, saying, ‘Pay me what you owe!’”

block.text: Amma o qul kәnara çıxıb ona yüz dinar borclu olan bir yoldaşını tapdı. Onu yaxaladı vә “Borcunu ödә!” deyәrәk boğmağa başladı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “So his fellow servant fell down at his feet and begged him, saying, ‘Have patience with me, and I will repay you!’

block.text: Yoldaşı yerә qapanıb ona “sәbir et, borcunu ödәyәcәyәm” deyә yalvardı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He would not, but went and cast him into prison, until he should pay back that which was due.

block.text: O isә istәmәdi. Gedib borcunu ödәyәnә qәdәr onu zindana saldırdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So when his fellow servants saw what was done, they were exceedingly sorry, and came and told to their lord all that was done.

block.text: Ağanın digәr qulları baş verәn hadisәni görәndә çox kәdәrlәndilәr vә gedib bütün olanı ağalarına nәql etdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then his lord called him in, and said to him, ‘You wicked servant! I forgave you all that debt, because you begged me.

block.text: Onda ağa o qulu yanına çağırıb dedi: “Ey pis qul, bütün o borcu sәnә bağışladım, çünki mәnә yalvardın.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Shouldn’t you also have had mercy on your fellow servant, even as I had mercy on you?’

block.text: Mәn sәnә mәrhәmәt etdiyim kimi sәn dә yoldaşına mәrhәmәt etmәli deyildinmi?”

ReferenceBlocks.text: His lord was angry, and delivered him to the tormentors, until he should pay all that was due to him.

block.text: Ağası qәzәblәnib bütün borcunu ödәyәnә qәdәr onu işgәncә verәnlәrә tәslim etdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So my heavenly Father will also do to you, if you don’t each forgive your brother from your hearts for his misdeeds.”

block.text: Hәr biriniz qardaşlarınızı ürәkdәn bağışlamasanız, Sәmavi Atam da sizә elә edәr>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW 19
It happened when Jesus had finished these words, he departed from Galilee, and came into the borders of Judea beyond the Jordan.

block.text: İsa söhbәtini bitirdikdәn sonra Qalileyadan çıxıb Yәhudeyanın İordan çayının o biri tayında yerlәşәn bölgәsinә getdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Great multitudes followed him, and he healed them there.

block.text: Böyük bir izdiham Onun ardınca gәldi. İsa orada onlara şәfa verdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Pharisees came to him, testing him, and saying,

block.text: Bәzi fariseylәr İsanın yanına gәlib Onu sınamaq üçün belә bir sual verdilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Is it lawful for a man to divorce his wife for any reason?”

block.text: <<İnsanın arvadını hәr sәbәbә görә boşamağa icazәsi varmı?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He answered,

block.text: İsa cavab verib dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Haven’t you read that he who made them from the beginning made them male and female?

block.text: <<Oxumamısınız ki, Yaradan başlanğıcdan “Onları kişi vә qadın olaraq yaratdı” vә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said, ‘For this cause a man shall leave his father and mother, and shall join to his wife; and the two shall become one flesh?’

block.text: “Buna görә dә kişi ata-anasını tәrk edib arvadına qovuşacaq vә ikisi bir bәdәn olacaq”?

ReferenceBlocks.text: So that they are no more two, but one flesh. What therefore God has joined together, don’t let man tear apart.”

block.text: Artıq onlar iki deyil, bir bәdәndir. Buna görә dә qoy Allahın birlәşdirdiyini insan ayırmasın>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They asked him,

block.text: Fariseylәr İsaya belә dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why then did Moses command us to give her a bill of divorce, and divorce her?”

block.text: <<Onda Musa nә üçün bir talaq kağızı verәrәk arvadını boşamağı әmr etdi?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: İsa onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Moses, because of the hardness of your hearts, allowed you to divorce your wives, but from the beginning it has not been so.

block.text: <<Ürәyinizin inadkar olduğuna görә Musa arvadlarınızı boşamağınıza icazә verdi. Amma başlanğıcdan belә deyildi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I tell you that whoever divorces his wife, except for sexual immorality, and marries another, commits adultery; and he who marries her when she is divorced commits adultery.”

block.text: Mәnsә sizә deyirәm ki, cinsi әxlaqsızlıqdan başqa bir sәbәbә görә arvadını boşayıb başqası ilә evlәnәn kәs zina edir>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: His disciples said to him,

block.text: Şagirdlәri İsaya dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If this is the case of the man with his wife, it is not good to marry.”

block.text: <<Әgәr әrlә arvad arasındakı münasibәt belә isә, demәli, evlәnmәmәk daha yaxşıdır>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he said to them,

block.text: Amma İsa onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Not all men can receive this saying, but those to whom it is given.

block.text: <<Hәr adam bu sözü qәbul edә bilmәz, ancaq bu qabiliyyәtin verildiyi adamlar qәbul edә bilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For there are eunuchs who were born that way from their mother’s womb, and there are eunuchs who were made eunuchs by men; and there are eunuchs who made themselves eunuchs for the Kingdom of Heaven’s sake. He who is able to receive it, let him receive it.”

block.text: Çünki elәlәri var ki, anadangәlmә xәdimdir, elәlәri var ki, insanlar tәrәfindәn xәdim ediliblәr, elәlәri dә var ki, Sәmavi Padşahlıq uğrunda özünü xәdim sayırlar. Bunu qәbul edә bilәn qәbul etsin>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then little children were brought to him, that he should lay his hands on them and pray; and the disciples rebuked them.
But Jesus said,

block.text: O zaman uşaqlar İsanın yanına gәtirildi ki, İsa onların üzәrinә әllәrini qoyub dua etsin. Şagirdlәr isә onlara qadağan etdilәr.
Amma İsa dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Allow the little children, and don’t forbid them to come to me; for the Kingdom of Heaven belongs to ones like these.”

block.text: <<Uşaqları buraxın, qoy Mәnim yanıma gәlsinlәr! Onlara mane olmayın! Çünki Sәmavi Padşahlıq belәlәrinә mәxsusdur>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He laid his hands on them, and departed from there.

block.text: İsa onların üzәrinә әllәrini qoyub oradan getdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, one came to him and said,

block.text: Bir adam İsanın yanına gәlib dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Good teacher, what good thing shall I do, that I may have eternal life?”

block.text: <<Müәllim, mәn nә yaxşılıq etmәliyәm ki, әbәdi hәyata malik olum?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to him,

block.text: İsa ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why do you call me good? No one is good but one, that is, God. But if you want to enter into life, keep the commandments.”

block.text: <<Nә üçün Mәndәn yaxşılıq barәsindә soruşursan? Yaxşı olan tәk Biri vardır. Әgәr sәn әbәdi hәyata qovuşmaq istәyirsәnsә, Onun әmrlәrinә riayәt et>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to him,

block.text: O adam İsadan

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Which ones?”

block.text: <<Hansı әmrlәrә?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said,

block.text: İsa da dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “‘You shall not murder.’ ‘You shall not commit adultery.’ ‘You shall not steal.’ ‘You shall not offer false testimony.’

block.text: <<“Qәtl etmә. Zina etmә. Oğurluq etmә. Yalandan şahidlik etmә.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ‘Honor your father and mother.’ And, ‘You shall love your neighbor as yourself.’”

block.text: Ata-anana hörmәt et”. Hәmçinin “qonşunu özün kimi sev”>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The young man said to him,

block.text: Cavan adam İsaya dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “All these things I have observed from my youth. What do I still lack?”

block.text: <<Bunların hamısına riayәt etmişәm, daha nәyim çatışmır?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: İsa ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If you want to be perfect, go, sell what you have, and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven; and come, follow me.”

block.text: <<Әgәr kamil olmaq istәyirsәnsә, get әmlakını satıb yoxsullara payla. Onda göylәrdә xәzinәn olacaq. Sonra qayıt, Mәnim ardımca gәl>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when the young man heard the saying, he went away sad, for he was one who had great possessions.
Jesus said to his disciples,

block.text: Lakin cavan adam bu sözü eşitdikdә kәdәrlәnib getdi, çünki var-dövlәti çox idi.
İsa şagirdlәrinә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Most certainly I say to you, a rich man will enter into the Kingdom of Heaven with difficulty.

block.text: <<Sizә doğrusunu deyirәm: varlı adamın Sәmavi Padşahlığa daxil olması çәtindir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Again I tell you, it is easier for a camel to go through a needle’s eye, than for a rich man to enter into the Kingdom of God.”

block.text: Yenә sizә deyirәm ki, dәvәnin iynә gözündәn keçmәsi varlı adamın Allahın Padşahlığına daxil olmasından asandır>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the disciples heard it, they were exceedingly astonished, saying,

block.text: Bunu eşidәn şagirdlәr çox tәәccüblәnәrәk dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who then can be saved?”

block.text: <<Elә isә, kim xilas ola bilәr?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Looking at them, Jesus said,

block.text: İsa onlara baxıb dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “With men this is impossible, but with God all things are possible.”

block.text: <<Bu, insanlar üçün qeyri-mümkündür, amma Allah üçün hәr şey mümkündür>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then Peter answered,

block.text: Bundan sonra Peter cavab verәrәk Ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, we have left everything, and followed you. What then will we have?”

block.text: <<Bax biz hәr şeyi qoyub Sәnin ardınca gәlmişik, әvәzindә nәyimiz olacaq?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to them,

block.text: İsa onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Most certainly I tell you that you who have followed me, in the regeneration when the Son of Man will sit on the throne of his glory, you also will sit on twelve thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel.

block.text: <<Sizә doğrusunu deyirәm: hәr şey yenilәşәndә, Bәşәr Oğlu izzәtli taxtına oturanda Mәnim ardımca gәlәn sizlәr dә İsrailin on iki qәbilәsinә hökm etmәk üçün on iki taxt üzәrindә oturacaqsınız.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Everyone who has left houses, or brothers, or sisters, or father, or mother, or wife, or children, or lands, for my name’s sake, will receive one hundred times, and will inherit eternal life.

block.text: Mәnim adım uğrunda ya evlәrini ya qardaşlarını ya bacılarını ya atasını ya anasını ya uşaqlarını vә yaxud tarlalarını atan hәr kәs bundan yüz dәfә artıq alacaq vә әbәdi hәyatı da irs olaraq alacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But many who are first will be last, and many who are last will be first.”

block.text: Amma birinci olanların çoxu axırıncı, axırıncı olanlar isә birinci olacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW 20
“For the Kingdom of Heaven is like a man who was the master of a household, who went out early in the morning to hire laborers for his vineyard.

block.text: Sәmavi Padşahlıq sәhәr erkәn durub öz üzüm bağı üçün işçi tutmağa çıxan ev sahibinә bәnzәyir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had agreed with the laborers for a denarius a day, he sent them into his vineyard.

block.text: O, işçilәrlә günü bir dinara razılaşıb onları üzüm bağına göndәrdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He went out about the third hour, and saw others standing idle in the marketplace.

block.text: Üçüncü saat radәlәrindә çıxıb meydanda işsiz durmuş adamları gördü.

ReferenceBlocks.text: To them he said, ‘You also go into the vineyard, and whatever is right I will give you.’ So they went their way.

block.text: Onlara da dedi: “Siz dә üzüm bağına gedin vә haqqınızı düz verәrәm”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Again he went out about the sixth and the ninth hour, and did likewise.

block.text: Onlar da bağa getdilәr. Altıncı vә doqquzuncu saat radәlәrindә yenә çıxıb belә etdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: About the eleventh hour he went out, and found others standing idle. He said to them, ‘Why do you stand here all day idle?’”

block.text: On birinci saat radәlәrindә çıxdı vә orada duran başqalarını tapıb onlara dedi: “Nә üçün bütün günü burada işsiz durursunuz?”

ReferenceBlocks.text: “They said to him, ‘Because no one has hired us.’” “He said to them, ‘You also go into the vineyard, and you will receive whatever is right.’

block.text: “Çünki heç kim bizә iş vermәdi” dedilәr. Onlara “siz dә üzüm bağına gedin” dedi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When evening had come, the lord of the vineyard said to his manager, ‘Call the laborers and pay them their wages, beginning from the last to the first.’”

block.text: Axşam olanda bağ sahibi öz nәzarәtçisinә dedi: “İşçilәri çağır vә axırıncılardan başlayaraq birincilәrә kimi muzdlarını ver”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “When those who were hired at about the eleventh hour came, they each received a denarius.

block.text: On birinci saat radәlәrindә işә gәlәnlәr adambaşına bir dinar aldılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the first came, they supposed that they would receive more; and they likewise each received a denarius.

block.text: Birinci gәlәnlәr isә daha çox alacaqlarını düşündülәr, lakin onlar da adambaşına bir dinar aldılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they received it, they murmured against the master of the household,
saying, ‘These last have spent one hour, and you have made them equal to us, who have borne the burden of the day and the scorching heat!’”

block.text: Pullarını aldıqları zaman ev sahibinә şikayәt edәrәk dedilәr:
“Bu әn axırıncılar cәmi bir saat işlәdilәr vә sәn onları günün ağırlığını vә qızmar istisini çәkәn bizlәrlә bir tutdun”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “But he answered one of them, ‘Friend, I am doing you no wrong. Didn’t you agree with me for a denarius?

block.text: O isә onlardan birinә cavab verib dedi: “Dostum, axı mәn sәnә haqsızlıq etmәdim, sәn mәnimlә bir dinara razılaşmadınmı?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Take that which is yours, and go your way. It is my desire to give to this last just as much as to you.

block.text: Haqqını al, get! Axırıncıya da sәnә verdiyim qәdәr vermәk istәyirәm.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Isn’t it lawful for me to do what I want to with what I own? Or is your eye evil, because I am good?’

block.text: Öz pulumla istәdiyimi etmәyә ixtiyarım yoxdurmu? Sәn mәnim comәrdliyimә qısqanırsan?”

ReferenceBlocks.text: So the last will be first, and the first last. For many are called, but few are chosen.”

block.text: Belәcә dә axırıncılar birinci, birincilәr isә axırıncı olacaq>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As Jesus was going up to Jerusalem, he took the twelve disciples aside, and on the way he said to them,

block.text: İsa Yerusәlimә gedәrkәn yolda On İki şagirdi kәnara çağırıb ayrıca onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, we are going up to Jerusalem, and the Son of Man will be delivered to the chief priests and scribes, and they will condemn him to death,

block.text: <<Bax Yerusәlimә qalxırıq, Bәşәr Oğlu başçı kahinlәrә vә ilahiyyatçılara tәslim olunacaq. Onu ölümә mәhkum edәcәklәr;

ReferenceBlocks.text: and will hand him over to the Gentiles to mock, to scourge, and to crucify; and the third day he will be raised up.”

block.text: әlә salaraq qamçılayıb çarmıxa çәksinlәr deyә başqa millәtlәrә tәslim edәcәklәr. O, üçüncü gün dirilәcәk>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then the mother of the sons of Zebedee came to him with her sons, worshipping him and asking a certain thing of him.
He said to her,

block.text: O zaman Zavday oğullarının anası oğulları ilә birlikdә İsaya yaxınlaşıb sәcdә qılaraq Ondan nә isә dilәdi.
İsa qadından

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What do you want?”

block.text: <<Sәn nә istәyirsәn?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: She said to him,

block.text: Qadın Ona dedi:

block.characterId: mother of the sons of Zebedee (James and John)

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: mother of the sons of Zebedee (James and John)
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Command that these, my two sons, may sit, one on your right hand, and one on your left hand, in your Kingdom.”

block.text: <<Әmr et ki, mәnim bu iki oğlum Sәnin Padşahlığında biri sağında, biri solunda otursun>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Jesus answered,

block.text: Amma İsa cavab verib dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You don’t know what you are asking. Are you able to drink the cup that I am about to drink, and be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with?”

block.text: <<Nә dilәdiyinizi özünüz dә bilmirsiniz. Mәnim içәcәyim kasadan siz dә içә bilәrsinizmi?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said to him,

block.text: Onlar dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We are able.”

block.text: <<Bilәrik>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: İsa onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You will indeed drink my cup, and be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with, but to sit on my right hand and on my left hand is not mine to give; but it is for whom it has been prepared by my Father.”

block.text: <<Mәnim içәcәyim kasadan içәcәksiniz. Amma sağımda vә yaxud solumda oturmağa izin vermәk Mәndәn asılı deyil. Atam oranı kimlәr üçün hazırlayıbsa, onlara verilәcәk>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the ten heard it, they were indignant with the two brothers.

block.text: Bunu eşidәn on şagirdin iki qardaşa acığı tutdu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Jesus summoned them, and said,

block.text: İsa şagirdlәri yanına çağırıb dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You know that the rulers of the nations lord it over them, and their great ones exercise authority over them.

block.text: <<Bilirsiniz ki, millәtlәrin rәhbәrlәri onların üzәrindә hökmranlıq, әyanları da onlara ağalıq edir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It shall not be so among you, but whoever desires to become great among you shall be your servant.

block.text: Sizin aranızda isә qoy belә olmasın. Sizlәrdәn böyük olmaq istәyәn xidmәtçiniz olsun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Whoever desires to be first among you shall be your bondservant.

block.text: Aranızda kim birinci olmaq istәsә, başqalarının qulu olsun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the Son of Man came not to be served, but to serve, and to give his life as a ransom for many.”

block.text: Belәcә Bәşәr Oğlu gәlmәdi ki, Ona xidmәt etsinlәr, gәldi ki, Özü xidmәt etsin vә çoxlarını satın almaq üçün Öz canını fidyә versin>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As they went out from Jericho, a great multitude followed him.

block.text: İsa şagirdlәri ilә Yerixodan çıxarkәn böyük bir izdiham Onun ardınca getdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, two blind men sitting by the road, when they heard that Jesus was passing by, cried out,

block.text: Yol kәnarında oturan iki kor adam İsanın oradan keçdiyini eşitdikdә deyә bağırdı:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, have mercy on us, you son of David!”

block.text: <<Ya Rәbb, ey Davud Oğlu! Bizә rәhm elә!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The multitude rebuked them, saying:

block.text: Dəstə-dəstə onlara dedi töhmətlənmək:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Be quiet!”

block.text: "Sakit olun!"

ReferenceBlocks.text: but they cried out even louder,

block.text: onlar deyә daha ucadan bağırdılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, have mercy on us, you son of David!”

block.text: <<Ya Rәbb, ey Davud Oğlu! Bizә rәhm elә!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus stood still, and called them, and asked,

block.text: İsa dayanıb onları çağırdı vә onlardan soruşdu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What do you want me to do for you?”

block.text: <<Nә istәyirsiniz, sizin üçün edim?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They told him,

block.text: Onlar dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, that our eyes may be opened.”

block.text: <<Ya Rәbb, gözlәrimiz açılsın>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus, being moved with compassion, touched their eyes; and immediately their eyes received their sight, and they followed him.

block.text: İsanın onlara rәhmi gәldi, gözlәrinә toxundu. Hәmin an onların gözlәri açıldı vә İsanın ardınca getdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW 21
When they drew near to Jerusalem, and came to Bethsphage, to the Mount of Olives, then Jesus sent two disciples,
saying to them,

block.text: Yerusәlimә yaxınlaşıb Zeytun dağının yamacındakı Bet-Faqeyә gәldiklәri zaman İsa iki şagirdi göndәrәrәk
onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Go into the village that is opposite you, and immediately you will find a donkey tied, and a colt with her. Untie them, and bring them to me.

block.text: <<Qarşınızdakı kәndә gedin. Dәrhal orada bağlanmış bir eşşәklә bir sıpa tapacaqsınız. Onları açıb Mәnә gәtirin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If anyone says anything to you, you shall say, ‘The Lord needs them,’ and immediately he will send them.”

block.text: Kim sizә bir şey desә, ona “bunlar Rәbbә lazımdır, tezliklә onları geri göndәrәcәk” deyәrsiniz>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: All this was done, that it might be fulfilled which was spoken through the prophet, saying,

block.text: Bunlar da peyğәmbәr vasitәsilә söylәnәn bu söz yerinә yetsin deyә baş verdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Tell the daughter of Zion, behold, your King comes to you, humble, and riding on a donkey, on a colt, the foal of a donkey.”

block.text: <<Sion qızına deyin ki, “Bax Padşahın sәnә tәrәf gәlir; O itaәtkardır vә bir eşşәyә – Eşşәyin balası olan sıpaya minib gәlir”>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The disciples went, and did just as Jesus commanded them.

block.text: Şagirdlәr gedib İsanın әmr etdiyi kimi etdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They brought the donkey and the colt, and laid their clothes on them; and he sat on them.

block.text: Eşşәklә sıpanı gәtirib üzәrlәrinә paltarlarını qoydular vә İsa sıpanın belinә mindi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A very great multitude spread their clothes on the road. Others cut branches from the trees, and spread them on the road.

block.text: Camaatın çoxu öz paltarlarını yola sәrdi. Bәzisi dә ağaclardan budaqlar kәsib yola döşәdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The multitudes who went before him, and who followed kept shouting,

block.text: İsanın önündә gedәn vә ardınca gәlәn xalq belә nida edirdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Hosanna to the son of David! Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord! Hosanna in the highest!”

block.text: <<Davud Oğluna hosanna! Rәbbin ismi ilә Gәlәnә alqış olsun! Әn ucalarda hosanna!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had come into Jerusalem, all the city was stirred up, saying,

block.text: İsa Yerusәlimә daxil olanda bütün şәhәr deyәrәk sarsıldı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who is this?”

block.text: <<Bu Kimdir?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The multitudes said,

block.text: Camaat isә deyirdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This is the prophet, Jesus, from Nazareth of Galilee.”

block.text: <<Bu, Qalileyanın Nazaret şәhәrindәn olan İsa Peyğәmbәrdir>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus entered into the temple of God, and drove out all of those who sold and bought in the temple, and overthrew the money changers’ tables and the seats of those who sold the doves.
He said to them,

block.text: İsa mәbәdә girib orada alver edәnlәrin hamısını qovdu. Sәrrafların masalarını vә göyәrçin satanların kürsülәrini çevirdi.
Onlara belә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It is written, ‘My house shall be called a house of prayer,’ but you have made it a den of robbers!”

block.text: <<“Mәnim evim dua evi adlandırılacaq” deyә yazılıb. Amma siz onu “quldur yuvasına” çevirmisiniz!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The blind and the lame came to him in the temple, and he healed them.

block.text: İsa mәbәddә Onun yanına gәlәn korlara vә axsaqlara şәfa verdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when the chief priests and the scribes saw the wonderful things that he did, and the children who were crying out in the temple and saying,

block.text: Lakin baş kahinlər və Şeytan onlara toxuna bilməz, və gözəl şeyi ki, o idi görüb edən məbədi və belə həyata ağlama edilmiş uşaqlar,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Hosanna to the son of David!”

block.text: <<Davud Oğluna hosanna!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: they were indignant,
and said to him,

block.text: onlar qəzəbli idi.
vә Ona dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do you hear what these are saying?”

block.text: <<Bunların nә söylәdiyini eşidirsәnmi?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to them,

block.text: İsa da onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Yes. Did you never read, ‘Out of the mouth of babes and nursing babies you have perfected praise?’”

block.text: <<Bәli. “Körpәlәrin vә çağaların ağzından Kamil hәmd aldın” sözünü heç oxumamısınızmı?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He left them, and went out of the city to Bethany, and lodged there.

block.text: İsa onları tәrk edib şәhәrdәn çıxdı. Bet-Anyaya gedib orada gecәlәdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now in the morning, as he returned to the city, he was hungry.

block.text: Sәhәri gün İsa şәhәrә qayıdanda acmışdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Seeing a fig tree by the road, he came to it, and found nothing on it but leaves. He said to it,

block.text: Yol kәnarında bir әncir ağacı gördü vә ona yaxınlaşdı. Amma ağacda yarpaqdan başqa bir şey tapmadı. İsa ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Let there be no fruit from you forever!”

block.text: <<Qoy bir daha sәnin meyvәn çıxmasın>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately the fig tree withered away.
When the disciples saw it, they marveled, saying,

block.text: Әncir ağacı o anda qurudu.
Şagirdlәr bunu gördükdә deyәrәk heyrәtlәndilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “How did the fig tree immediately wither away?”

block.text: <<Әncir ağacı bir anda necә qurudu?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered them,

block.text: İsa cavab verib onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Most certainly I tell you, if you have faith, and don’t doubt, you will not only do what was done to the fig tree, but even if you told this mountain, ‘Be taken up and cast into the sea,’ it would be done.

block.text: <<Sizә doğrusunu deyirәm: әgәr imanınız olub şübhә etmәsәniz, nәinki әncir ağacının başına gәtirilәn şeyi edәrsiniz, hәtta bu dağa “Qalx, dәnizә atıl!” desәniz, elә dә olacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: All things, whatever you ask in prayer, believing, you will receive.”

block.text: İmanla dua edәrәk hәr nә dilәsәniz, alacaqsınız>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had come into the temple, the chief priests and the elders of the people came to him as he was teaching, and said,

block.text: İsa mәbәdә gәlib tәlim öyrәdәrkәn başçı kahinlәr vә xalqın ağsaqqalları Ona yaxınlaşıb dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “By what authority do you do these things? Who gave you this authority?”

block.text: <<Sәn bu işlәri hansı sәlahiyyәtlә edirsәn? Sәnә bu sәlahiyyәti kim verib?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered them,

block.text: İsa onlara belә cavab verdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I also will ask you one question. If you tell me, I will tell you by what authority I do these things.

block.text: <<Mәn dә sizә bir sual verәcәyәm; onu Mәnә desәniz, Mәn dә bunları hansı sәlahiyyәtlә etdiyimi sizә deyәrәm.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The baptism of John, where was it from? From heaven or from men?”

block.text: Yәhyanın vәftizi haradan idi? Göydәnmi, yoxsa insanlardan?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They reasoned with themselves, saying,

block.text: Onlar isә aralarında müzakirә edәrәk belә dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ he will ask us, ‘Why then did you not believe him?’

block.text: <<Әgәr desәk “göydәn”, “Bәs nә üçün ona inanmadınız?” deyәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But if we say, ‘From men,’ we fear the multitude, for all hold John as a prophet.”

block.text: Amma desәk “insanlardan”, camaatdan qorxuruq, çünki hamı Yәhyanı peyğәmbәr sayır>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They answered Jesus, and said,

block.text: Cavabında İsaya dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We don’t know.”

block.text: <<Bilmirik>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He also said to them,

block.text: İsa da onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Neither will I tell you by what authority I do these things.

block.text: <<Bunları hansı sәlahiyyәtlә etdiyimi Mәn dә sizә demirәm.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But what do you think? A man had two sons, and he came to the first, and said, ‘Son, go work today in my vineyard.’

block.text: Bәs siz necә düşünürsünüz? Bir adamın iki oğlu vardı. Gәlib birincisinә “oğlum, bu gün get üzüm bağımda işlә” dedi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He answered, ‘I will not,’ but afterward he changed his mind, and went.

block.text: O da cavab verib “istәmirәm” dedi. Lakin sonra peşman olub getdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He came to the second, and said the same thing. He answered, ‘I go, sir,’ but he didn’t go.

block.text: Adam ikincisinә yaxınlaşıb yenә eyni sözü söylәdi. O cavab verib “Gedirәm, ağam!” dedi, amma getmәdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Which one of the two did the will of his father?”

block.text: Bu iki nәfәrdәn hansı atasının istәyini yerinә yetirdi?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said to him,

block.text: Onlar dedilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The first.”

block.text: <<birincisi>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to them,

block.text: İsa onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Most certainly I tell you that the tax collectors and the prostitutes are entering into the Kingdom of God before you.

block.text: <<Sizә doğrusunu deyirәm: vergiyığanlar vә fahişәlәr Allahın Padşahlığına sizdәn qabaq girirlәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For John came to you in the way of righteousness, and you didn’t believe him, but the tax collectors and the prostitutes believed him. When you saw it, you didn’t even repent afterward, that you might believe him.”

block.text: Çünki Yәhya sizin yanınıza salehlik yolunu göstәrmәyә gәldi. Siz isә ona inanmadınız, amma vergiyığanlar vә fahişәlәr ona inandılar. Siz bunu gördükdәn sonra da peşman olub ona inanmadınız.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Hear another parable. There was a man who was a master of a household, who planted a vineyard, set a hedge about it, dug a winepress in it, built a tower, leased it out to farmers, and went into another country.

block.text: Başqa bir mәsәli dinlәyin: Ev sahibi olan bir adam var idi. Üzüm bağı saldı, oranın әtrafına çәpәr çәkdi. İçindә yer qazaraq üzümsıxan düzәltdi, nәzarәt qüllәsi tikdi. Sonra isә bağı bağbanlara icarәyә verәrәk başqa ölkәyә getdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the season for the fruit drew near, he sent his servants to the farmers, to receive his fruit.

block.text: Mәhsul vaxtı çatanda mәhsulunu almaq üçün qullarını bağbanların yanına göndәrdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The farmers took his servants, beat one, killed another, and stoned another.

block.text: Lakin bağbanlar onun qullarını tutub kimini döydülәr, kimini öldürdülәr, kimini dә daşqalaq elәdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Again, he sent other servants more than the first: and they treated them the same way.

block.text: Bağ sahibi yenә әvvәlkindәn daha çox başqa qullar göndәrdi. Bağbanlar onlarla da әvvәlki kimi etdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But afterward he sent to them his son, saying, ‘They will respect my son.’

block.text: “Oğluma hörmәt edәrlәr” deyәrәk axırda öz oğlunu onların yanına göndәrdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the farmers, when they saw the son, said among themselves, ‘This is the heir. Come, let’s kill him, and seize his inheritance.’

block.text: Bağbanlar isә oğulu görәndә öz aralarında dedilәr: “Varis budur. Gәlin onu öldürәk vә miras bizә qalsın”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So they took him, and threw him out of the vineyard, and killed him.

block.text: Belәcә onu tutub bağdan kәnara çıxararaq öldürdülәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When therefore the lord of the vineyard comes, what will he do to those farmers?”

block.text: Belәliklә, bağın sahibi gәldikdә bu bağbanlara nә edәcәk?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They told him,

block.text: Onlar İsaya dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He will destroy those miserable men, and will lease out the vineyard to other farmers, who will give him the fruit in its season.”

block.text: <<Bu xainlәri dәhşәtli şәkildә hәlak edәcәk, üzüm bağını isә başqa bağbanlara icarәyә verәcәk ki, onlar mәhsulu öz vaxtında ona versinlәr>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to them,

block.text: İsa onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Did you never read in the Scriptures, ‘The stone which the builders rejected, the same was made the head of the corner. This was from the Lord. It is marvelous in our eyes?’”

block.text: <<Mәgәr siz Müqәddәs Yazılarda bunu heç oxumamısınızmı? “Bәnnaların rәdd etdiyi daş Guşәdaşı olub. Bu, Rәbbin işi idi, Gözümüzdә xariqәli bir işdir”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Therefore I tell you, the Kingdom of God will be taken away from you, and will be given to a nation bringing forth its fruit.

block.text: Buna görә sizә deyirәm: Allahın Padşahlığı sizdәn alınıb onun mәhsullarını yetişdirәcәk bir millәtә verilәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He who falls on this stone will be broken to pieces, but on whomever it will fall, it will scatter him as dust.”

block.text: Bu daşın üstünә yıxılan kәs parçalanacaq, daş isә kimin üzәrinә düşәrsә, onu әzәcәk>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the chief priests and the Pharisees heard his parables, they perceived that he spoke about them.

block.text: Başçı kahinlәr vә fariseylәr Onun mәsәllәrini eşitdikdә bu sözlәri onlar üçün dediyini başa düşdülәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they sought to seize him, they said:

block.text: O zaman onlar onu ələ keçirmək istədilər, onlar:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We fear the people because they think he is a prophet.”

block.text: "Biz insanlar o bir peyğəmbər hesab çünki qorxuram".

ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW 22
Jesus answered and spoke again in parables to them, saying,

block.text: İsa yenә onlara mәsәllәrlә xitab edәrәk dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The Kingdom of Heaven is like a certain king, who made a marriage feast for his son.

block.text: <<Sәmavi Padşahlıq oğluna toy ziyafәti verәn bir padşaha bәnzәyir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He sent out his servants to call those who were invited to the marriage feast, but they would not come.

block.text: O, toy ziyafәtinә dәvәt olunanları çağırmaq üçün qullarını göndәrdi. Lakin onlar gәlmәk istәmәdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Again he sent out other servants, saying, ‘Tell those who are invited, “Behold, I have prepared my dinner. My cattle and my fatlings are killed, and all things are ready. Come to the marriage feast!”’”

block.text: Bir daha başqa qulları göndәrәrәk onlara dedi: “Dәvәt olunanlara deyin ki, budur, mәn ziyafәtimi hazırladım, öküzlәrim vә bәslәnmiş heyvanlarım kәsilib, hәr şey hazırdır, toy ziyafәtinә gәlin!”

ReferenceBlocks.text: “But they made light of it, and went their ways, one to his own farm, another to his merchandise.

block.text: Amma dәvәt olunanlar etinasızlıq göstәrәrәk kimi tarlasına, kimi ticarәtinә getdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The rest grabbed his servants, and treated them shamefully, and killed them.

block.text: O birilәri isә onun qullarını tutub tәhqir etdilәr vә öldürdülәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the king heard that, he was angry, and sent his armies, destroyed those murderers, and burned their city.”

block.text: Padşah bundan xәbәr tutaraq qәzәblәndi. Öz qoşunlarını göndәrib o qatillәri mәhv etdi, şәhәrlәrini isә yandırdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Then he said to his servants, ‘The wedding is ready, but those who were invited weren’t worthy.

block.text: Onda qullarına dedi: “Toy ziyafәti hazırdır, fәqәt dәvәt olunanlar buna layiq deyil.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Go therefore to the intersections of the highways, and as many as you may find, invite to the marriage feast.’”

block.text: Belәliklә, yolayrıclarına gedin vә kimi tapsanız, toy ziyafәtinә dәvәt edin”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Those servants went out into the highways, and gathered together as many as they found, both bad and good. The wedding was filled with guests.

block.text: Hәmin qullar yollara çıxdılar. Pis-yaxşı kimi tapdılarsa, hamısını topladılar. Toy mәclisi qonaqlarla doldu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when the king came in to see the guests, he saw there a man who didn’t have on wedding clothing,

block.text: Padşah qonaqlara baxmaq üçün girdikdә orada toy libası geymәmiş bir nәfәri gördü,

ReferenceBlocks.text: and he said to him, ‘Friend, how did you come in here not wearing wedding clothing?’ He was speechless.

block.text: ona dedi: “Dostum! Sәn toy libası geymәmiş buraya necә girdin?” O isә susdu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then the king said to the servants, ‘Bind him hand and foot, take him away, and throw him into the outer darkness; there is where the weeping and grinding of teeth will be.’

block.text: O zaman padşah xidmәtçilәrә dedi: “Onun әllәrini, ayaqlarını bağlayın vә qaranlıq çölә atın! Orada ağlaşma vә diş qıcırtısı olacaq”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For many are called, but few chosen.”

block.text: Çünki dәvәt edilmiş çox, seçilmiş isә azdır>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then the Pharisees went and took counsel how they might entrap him in his words.

block.text: O zaman fariseylәr gedib mәslәhәtlәşirdilәr ki, Onu söz üstündә necә tutsunlar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They sent their disciples to him, along with the Herodians, saying,

block.text: Onlar hirodçularla birgә öz şagirdlәrini İsanın yanına göndәrib dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Teacher, we know that you are honest, and teach the way of God in truth, no matter whom you teach, for you aren’t partial to anyone.

block.text: <<Müәllim, biz bilirik ki, Sәn etibarlı adamsan, Allahın yolunu hәqiqәtә görә öyrәdirsәn vә heç kimә tәrәfkeşlik etmirsәn. Çünki insanlar arasında fәrq qoymursan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Tell us therefore, what do you think? Is it lawful to pay taxes to Caesar, or not?”

block.text: İndi bizә de görәk, Sәncә bizim üçün qeysәrә vergi vermәyә icazә var ya yox?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Jesus perceived their wickedness, and said,

block.text: Amma İsa onların pis niyyәtini bilәrәk dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why do you test me, you hypocrites?
Show me the tax money.”

block.text: <<Ey ikiüzlülәr, Mәni niyә sınağa çәkirsiniz?
Vergi verdiyiniz sikkәni Mәnә göstәrin>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They brought to him a denarius.
He asked them,

block.text: Onlar da Ona bir dinar gәtirdilәr.
İsa onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Whose is this image and inscription?”

block.text: <<Sikkәnin üstündәki bu tәsvir vә yazı kimindir?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said to him,

block.text: Ona dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Caesar’s.”

block.text: <<Qeysәrin>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he said to them,

block.text: O vaxt İsa onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Give therefore to Caesar the things that are Caesar’s, and to God the things that are God’s.”

block.text: <<Elә isә, qeysәrin haqqını qeysәrә, Allahın haqqını Allaha verin>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they heard it, they marveled, and left him, and went away.

block.text: Bunu eşitdiklәri zaman heyrәtlәndilәr vә İsanı tәrk edib getdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: On that day Sadducees (those who say that there is no resurrection) came to him. They asked him,
saying,

block.text: Hәmin gün dirilmәnin olmadığını iddia edәn bәzi sadukeylәr İsanın yanına gәlib
soruşdular:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Teacher, Moses said, ‘If a man dies, having no children, his brother shall marry his wife, and raise up seed for his brother.’

block.text: <<Müәllim, Musa belә demişdir: “Әgәr bir adam övladsız ölsә, qardaşı onun dul qalmış arvadını alıb ölәn qardaşın nәslini davam etdirsin”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now there were with us seven brothers. The first married and died, and since he had no children, he left his wife to his brother.

block.text: Aramızda yeddi qardaş var idi. Birincisi bir arvad aldı vә öldü. Uşağı olmadığından arvadı ilә qardaşı evlәndi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In the same way, the second also, and the third, to the seventh.

block.text: İkincisi vә üçüncüsü, hәtta yeddincisinә qәdәr elәcә öldü.

ReferenceBlocks.text: After them all, the woman died.

block.text: Hamısından sonra bu qadın da öldü.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In the resurrection therefore, whose wife will she be of the seven? For they all had her.”

block.text: İndi ölülәr dirilәndә bu qadın o yeddi nәfәrdәn hansının arvadı olacaq? Çünki hamısı bu qadını almışdı>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Jesus answered them,

block.text: İsa cavab verib onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You are mistaken, not knowing the Scriptures, nor the power of God.

block.text: <<Müqәddәs Yazıları vә Allahın qüdrәtini bilmәdiyinizә görә yanılırsınız.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For in the resurrection they neither marry, nor are given in marriage, but are like God’s angels in heaven.

block.text: Ona görә ki ölülәr dirilәndә insanlar nә evlәnir, nә dә әrә gedirlәr. Ancaq sәmadakı mәlәklәr kimi olurlar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But concerning the resurrection of the dead, haven’t you read that which was spoken to you by God when He said:

block.text: But concerning the resurrection of the dead, haven't you read that which was spoken to you by God when He said:

ReferenceBlocks.text: ‘I am the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob?’ God is not the God of the dead, but of the living.”

block.text: 'I am the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob?' God is not the God of the dead, but of the living.”

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the multitudes heard it, they were astonished at his teaching.

block.text: Bunları eşidәn camaat Onun tәliminә tәәccüblәnirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the Pharisees, when they heard that he had silenced the Sadducees, gathered themselves together.

block.text: Fariseylәr İsanın sadukeylәri susdurduğunu eşidәndә bir yerә toplaşdılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: One of them, a lawyer, asked him a question, testing him.

block.text: Onlardan biri olan qanunşünas İsanı sınamaq mәqsәdi ilә Ondan bunu soruşdu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Teacher, which is the greatest commandment in the law?”

block.text: <<Müәllim, Qanunda әn böyük әmr hansıdır?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: İsa ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “‘You shall love the Lord your God with all your heart, with all your soul, and with all your mind.’

block.text: <<“Allahın Rәbbi bütün qәlbinlә, bütün varlığınla vә bütün düşüncәnlә sev”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This is the first and great commandment.

block.text: Bu, böyük vә әsas әmrdir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A second likewise is this, ‘You shall love your neighbor as yourself.’

block.text: Buna bәnzәyәn ikincisi budur: “Qonşunu özün kimi sev”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The whole law and the prophets depend on these two commandments.”

block.text: Bütün Qanun vә Peyğәmbәrlәrin sözlәri bu iki әmrә әsaslanır>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now while the Pharisees were gathered together, Jesus asked them a question,
saying,

block.text: Fariseylәr toplaşdıqda İsa onlardan bunu soruşdu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What do you think of the Christ? Whose son is he?”

block.text: <<Mәsih haqqında nә düşünürsünüz? O kimin Oğludur?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said to him,

block.text: Onlar da İsaya dedilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Of David.”

block.text: <<Davudun Oğlu>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: İsa onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “How then does David in the Spirit call him Lord, saying,

block.text: <<Elә isә, nә üçün Davud Ruh vasitәsilә Ona “Ağa” deyә müraciәt edir?

ReferenceBlocks.text: ‘The Lord said to my Lord, sit on my right hand, until I make your enemies a footstool for your feet?’”

block.text: “Rәbb mәnim Ağama dedi: ‹Mәn düşmәnlәrini ayaqlarının altına salanadәk Sağımda otur›” deyib.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If then David calls him Lord, how is he his son?”

block.text: Әgәr Davud Ona “Ağa” deyә müraciәt edirsә, O necә Davudun oğlu ola bilәr?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: No one was able to answer him a word, neither did any man dare ask him any more questions from that day forth.

block.text: Bunun cavabında İsaya kimsә bir söz deyә bilmәdi. O gündәn sonra artıq heç kim Ondan bir şey soruşmağa cәsarәt etmәdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW 23
Then Jesus spoke to the multitudes and to his disciples,
saying,

block.text: Bundan sonra İsa camaata vә şagirdlәrinә müraciәt edib
dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The scribes and the Pharisees sat on Moses’ seat.

block.text: <<İlahiyyatçılar vә fariseylәr Musanın kürsüsündә oturmuşlar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: All things therefore whatever they tell you to observe, observe and do, but don’t do their works; for they say, and don’t do.

block.text: Buna görә dә sizә әmr etdiklәri hәr şeyә riayәt vә әmәl edin. Amma onların etdiklәrini etmәyin, çünki söylәyәrlәr, amma riayәt etmәzlәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For they bind heavy burdens that are grievous to be borne, and lay them on men’s shoulders; but they themselves will not lift a finger to help them.

block.text: Ağır vә çәtin daşına bilәn yüklәri bağlayıb insanların çiyninә yüklәyәrlәr, özlәri isә bu yüklәri daşımaq üçün barmaqlarını belә, tәrpәtmәk istәmәzlәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But all their works they do to be seen by men. They make their phylacteries broad, enlarge the fringes of their garments.

block.text: Onlar öz әmәllәrinin hamısını insanlar görsün deyә edәrlәr. Çünki onlar dua qutucuqlarını genişlәndirib geyimlәrinin qotazlarını uzadarlar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They love the place of honor at feasts, and the best seats in the synagogues.

block.text: Ziyafәtlәrdә yuxarı başı vә sinaqoqlarda baş kürsülәri tutmağı,

ReferenceBlocks.text: They love to be greeted in the marketplaces, and to be called ‘Rabbi, Rabbi’ by men.

block.text: bazar meydanlarında salam almağı, insanların onlara “Rabbi!” deyә xitab etmәsini sevәrlәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But don’t you be called ‘Rabbi,’ for one is your teacher, the Christ, and all of you are brothers.

block.text: Amma kimsә sizi “Rabbi” deyә çağırmasın. Çünki sizin bir Müәlliminiz var. Siz hamınız isә qardaşsınız.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Call no man on the earth your father, for one is your Father, he who is in heaven.

block.text: Yer üzündә kimsәyә “ata” demәyin. Çünki bir Atanız var, O da Sәmavi Atadır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Neither be called masters, for one is your master, the Christ.

block.text: Kimsә sizә “rәhbәr” demәsin. Çünki bir Rәhbәriniz var, O da Mәsihdir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he who is greatest among you will be your servant.

block.text: Aranızda әn böyük olan xidmәtçiniz olsun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Whoever exalts himself will be humbled, and whoever humbles himself will be exalted.”

block.text: Kim özünü yüksәldәrsә, aşağı tutulacaq vә kim özünü aşağı tutarsa, yüksәldilәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you devour widows’ houses, and as a pretense you make long prayers. Therefore you will receive greater damnation.”

block.text: Vay halınıza, ey ilahiyyatçılar vә fariseylәr – ikiüzlülәr! Çünki siz Sәmavi Padşahlığı insanların üzünә qapayırsınız. Nә özünüz girirsiniz, nә dә girmәk istәyәnlәri buraxırsınız.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “But woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! Because you shut up the Kingdom of Heaven against men; for you don’t enter in yourselves, neither do you allow those who are entering in to enter.

block.text: “But woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! Because you shut up the Kingdom of Heaven against men; for you don't enter in yourselves, neither do you allow those who are entering in to enter.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you travel around by sea and land to make one proselyte; and when he becomes one, you make him twice as much of a son of Gehenna as yourselves.”

block.text: Vay halınıza, ey ilahiyyatçılar vә fariseylәr – ikiüzlülәr! Çünki siz dәnizi vә qurunu dolaşırsınız ki, bir nәfәri dinә gәtirәsiniz. Dinә gәtirdikdә isә onu özünüzdәn ikiqat artıq cәhәnnәmlik edirsiniz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Woe to you, you blind guides, who say, ‘Whoever swears by the temple, it is nothing; but whoever swears by the gold of the temple, he is obligated.’

block.text: Vay halınıza, ey kor rәhbәrlәr! Deyirsiniz ki, “kim mәbәdә and içirsә, әhәmiyyәtli bir şey deyil, lakin kim mәbәdin qızılına and içirsә, öz andına borcludur”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You blind fools! For which is greater, the gold, or the temple that sanctifies the gold?

block.text: Ey ağılsızlar vә korlar! Hansı daha böyükdür? Qızılmı, yoxsa qızılı tәqdis edәn mәbәdmi?

ReferenceBlocks.text: ‘Whoever swears by the altar, it is nothing; but whoever swears by the gift that is on it, he is obligated?’

block.text: Yenә dә deyirsiniz ki, “kim qurbangaha and içirsә, әhәmiyyәtli bir şey deyil; lakin qurbangah üzәrindәki qurbana and içәn öz andını yerinә yetirmәlidir”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You blind fools! For which is greater, the gift, or the altar that sanctifies the gift?

block.text: Ey korlar! Hansı daha böyükdür? Qurbanmı, yoxsa qurbanı tәqdis edәn qurbangahmı?

ReferenceBlocks.text: He therefore who swears by the altar, swears by it, and by everything on it.

block.text: Belәliklә, qurbangaha and içәn kәs ona vә onun üstündә olan bütün şeylәrә and içir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He who swears by the temple, swears by it, and by him who was living in it.

block.text: Mәbәdә and içәn kәs ona vә içindә Yaşayana and içir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He who swears by heaven, swears by the throne of God, and by the one who sits on it.”

block.text: Göyә and içәn kәs dә Allahın taxtına vә taxtda Oturana and içir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you tithe mint, dill, and cumin, and have left undone the weightier matters of the law: justice, mercy, and faith. But you ought to have done these, and not to have left the other undone.

block.text: Vay halınıza, ey ilahiyyatçılar vә fariseylәr – ikiüzlülәr! Çünki siz nanә, şüyüd vә zirәnin onda birini verirsiniz, lakin Qanunun daha vacib işlәrini, әdalәti, mәrhәmәti vә imanı atırsınız. Amma onda birini vermәklә yanaşı bunları da yerinә yetirmәli idiniz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You blind guides, who strain out a gnat, and swallow a camel!”

block.text: Ey kor rәhbәr! Ağcaqanadı süzgәclә çıxarır, dәvәni isә udursunuz!

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you clean the outside of the cup and of the platter, but within they are full of extortion and unrighteousness.”

block.text: Vay halınıza, ey ilahiyyatçılar vә fariseylәr – ikiüzlülәr! Çünki siz kasanın vә boşqabın bayır tәrәfini tәmizlәyirsiniz, lakin onların daxili soyğunçuluq vә pozğunluqla doludur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You blind Pharisee, first clean the inside of the cup and of the platter, that its outside may become clean also.”

block.text: Sәn, ey kor farisey! Әvvәlcә kasanın daxilini tәmizlә ki, bayır tәrәfi dә tәmiz olsun!

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you are like whitened tombs, which outwardly appear beautiful, but inwardly are full of dead men’s bones, and of all uncleanness.

block.text: Vay halınıza, ey ilahiyyatçılar vә fariseylәr – ikiüzlülәr! Çünki siz ağardılmış mәqbәrәlәrә bәnzәyirsiniz: onların bayır tәrәfi gözәl görünür, daxili isә ölü sümüklәri vә hәr cür murdarlıqla doludur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Even so you also outwardly appear righteous to men, but inwardly you are full of hypocrisy and iniquity.”

block.text: Siz dә zahirәn insanlara saleh görünürsünüz, daxilәn isә ikiüzlülük vә qanunsuzluqla dolusunuz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you build the tombs of the prophets, and decorate the tombs of the righteous.

block.text: Vay halınıza, ey ilahiyyatçılar vә fariseylәr – ikiüzlülәr! Çünki siz peyğәmbәrlәrә mәqbәrәlәr tikirsiniz, salehlәrin abidәlәrini bәzәyirsiniz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You say, ‘If we had lived in the days of our fathers, we wouldn’t have been partakers with them in the blood of the prophets.’

block.text: “Biz ata-babalarımızın yaşadığı günlәrdә yaşasaydıq, peyğәmbәrlәrin qanını tökmәkdә onlarla şәrik olmazdıq” deyirsiniz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore you testify to yourselves that you are children of those who killed the prophets.

block.text: Belәliklә, peyğәmbәrlәri öldürәnlәrin övladları olduğunuza özünüz şәhadәt edirsiniz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Fill up, then, the measure of your fathers.

block.text: Elә isә, ata-babalarınızın başladığı işi başa çatdırın!

ReferenceBlocks.text: You serpents, you offspring of vipers, how will you escape the judgment of Gehenna?

block.text: Siz ey ilanlar, gürzәlәr nәsli! Cәhәnnәmә mәhkum edilmәkdәn necә qaçacaqsınız?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore behold, I send to you prophets, wise men, and scribes. Some of them you will kill and crucify; and some of them you will scourge in your synagogues, and persecute from city to city.

block.text: Ona görә dә Mәn sizә peyğәmbәrlәr, müdrik adamlar vә ilahiyyatçılar göndәrirәm. Siz onlardan bәzisini öldürәcәk vә çarmıxa çәkәcәksiniz. Bәzisini sinaqoqlarınızda qamçılayacaq vә şәhәrdәn şәhәrә qovacaqsınız.

ReferenceBlocks.text: And so on you may come all the righteous blood shed on the earth, from the blood of righteous Abel to the blood of Zachariah son of Barachiah, whom you killed between the sanctuary and the altar.

block.text: Belә ki saleh olan Habilin qanından tutmuş mәbәdlә qurbangahın arasında öldürdüyünüz Berekya oğlu Zәkәriyyәnin qanına qәdәr yer üzündә tökülәn bütün saleh adamların qanı üçün mәsuliyyәt daşıyasınız.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Most certainly I tell you, all these things will come upon this generation.”

block.text: Sizә doğrusunu deyirәm: bütün bu şeylәr üçün bu nәsil mәsuliyyәt daşıyacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Jerusalem, Jerusalem, who kills the prophets, and stones those who are sent to her! How often I would have gathered your children together, even as a hen gathers her chicks under her wings, and you would not!

block.text: Ey Yerusәlim, Yerusәlim! Peyğәmbәrlәri öldürәn vә ora göndәrilәnlәri daşqalaq edәn şәhәr! Toyuq cücәlәrini qanadları altına yığan kimi Mәn dә dәfәlәrlә sәnin övladlarını yığmaq istәdim, siz isә istәmәdiniz!

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, your house is left to you desolate.

block.text: Baxın, eviniz viran qalır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For I tell you, you will not see me from now on, until you say, ‘Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord!’”

block.text: Çünki Mәn sizә bunu deyirәm: “Rәbbin ismi ilә Gәlәnә alqış olsun!” deyәnә qәdәr Mәni bir daha görmәyәcәksiniz>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW 24
Jesus went out from the temple, and was going on his way. His disciples came to him and said:

block.text: İsa out tapınak ki, getdi və onun yolunu davam edirdi. Onun şagirdləri ona gəlib dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Master, look at all these magnificent buildings.”

block.text: "Master, bütün bu möhtəşəm binalar oldu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he answered them,

block.text: İsa onlara cavab verib dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You see all of these things, don’t you? Most certainly I tell you, there will not be left here one stone on another, that will not be thrown down.”

block.text: <<Bütün bunları görürsünüzmü? Sizә doğrusunu deyirәm: onların daşı daş üstündә qalmayacaq, hamısı yerlә yeksan olacaq>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As he sat on the Mount of Olives, the disciples came to him privately, saying,

block.text: İsa Zeytun dağında oturanda şagirdlәr ayrılıqda Onun yanına gәlib dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Tell us, when will these things be? What is the sign of your coming, and of the end of the age?”

block.text: <<Bizә söylә, bu dediklәrin nә vaxt baş verәcәk? Sәnin zühurun vә dövrün sonuna hansı әlamәtlәr olacaq?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered them,

block.text: İsa onlara cavab verib dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Be careful that no one leads you astray.

block.text: <<Ehtiyatlı olun, qoy sizi heç kim aldatmasın.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For many will come in my name, saying, ‘I am the Christ,’ and will lead many astray.

block.text: Çünki Mәnim adımla çox adam gәlib “Mәsih mәnәm” deyәrәk çoxlarını aldadacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You will hear of wars and rumors of wars. See that you aren’t troubled, for all this must happen, but the end is not yet.

block.text: Siz müharibәlәr vә müharibә xәbәrlәri eşidәcәksiniz. Amma tәlaşa düşmәyin. Bunlar baş vermәlidir, amma bu hәlә hәr şeyin axırı deyil.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom; and there will be famines, plagues, and earthquakes in various places.

block.text: Çünki millәt millәtә, padşahlıq padşahlığa qarşı çıxacaq. Yerbәyer aclıq vә zәlzәlәlәr olacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But all these things are the beginning of birth pains.

block.text: Bütün bunlar sanki doğuş ağrılarının başlanğıcıdır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then they will deliver you up to oppression, and will kill you. You will be hated by all of the nations for my name’s sake.

block.text: O zaman sizi әziyyәtә tәslim edib öldürәcәklәr. Mәnim adıma görә bütün millәtlәr sizә nifrәt edәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then many will stumble, and will deliver up one another, and will hate one another.

block.text: Onda bir çoxu imandan büdrәyәrәk bir-birini tәslim edәcәk vә bir-birinә nifrәt edәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Many false prophets will arise, and will lead many astray.

block.text: Bir çox yalançı peyğәmbәr törәyib çox adamı aldadacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Because iniquity will be multiplied, the love of many will grow cold.

block.text: Qanunsuzluq çoxaldığı üçün bir çoxunun mәhәbbәti soyuyacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he who endures to the end will be saved.

block.text: Amma axıracan dözәn xilas olacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This Good News of the Kingdom will be preached in the whole world for a testimony to all the nations, and then the end will come.”

block.text: Sәmavi Padşahlığın bu Müjdәsi bütün millәtlәrә şәhadәt olmaq üçün bütün dünyada vәz edilәcәk. O zaman hәr şeyin axırı gәlәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “When, therefore, you see the abomination of desolation, which was spoken of through Daniel the prophet, standing in the holy place (let the reader understand),

block.text: Belәliklә, Daniel peyğәmbәrin bәhs etdiyi viranәlik gәtirәn iyrәnc şeyin Müqәddәs mәkanda qoyulduğunu gördüyünüz zaman – qoy oxuyan bunu anlasın –

ReferenceBlocks.text: then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains.

block.text: Yәhudeyada olanlar dağlara qaçsın.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Let him who is on the housetop not go down to take out things that are in his house.

block.text: Damda olan evindәki әşyaları götürmәk üçün aşağı enmәsin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Let him who is in the field not return back to get his clothes.

block.text: Tarlada olan üst paltarını götürmәk üçün geri qayıtmasın.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But woe to those who are with child and to nursing mothers in those days!

block.text: Hәmin günlәr hamilәlәrin vә körpә әmizdirәnlәrin vay halına!

ReferenceBlocks.text: Pray that your flight will not be in the winter, nor on a Sabbath.

block.text: Dua edin ki, qaçmağınız qış fәslindә vә ya Şәnbә günündә baş vermәsin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For then there will be great oppression, such as has not been from the beginning of the world until now, no, nor ever will be.

block.text: Çünki o vaxt elә dәhşәtli әzab-әziyyәt olacaq ki, dünyanın başlanğıcından indiyә qәdәr belәsi olmayıb vә heç olmayacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Unless those days had been shortened, no flesh would have been saved. But for the sake of the chosen ones, those days will be shortened.”

block.text: Әgәr o günlәr qısaldılmasaydı, heç bir insan xilas ola bilmәzdi. Amma seçilmişlәrә görә o günlәr qısaldılacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Then if anyone tells you, ‘Behold, here is the Christ,’ or, ‘There,’ don’t believe it.

block.text: O zaman әgәr kimsә sizә desә ki, “bax, Mәsih buradadır” yaxud da “oradadır”, inanmayın.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For there will arise false christs, and false prophets, and they will show great signs and wonders, so as to lead astray, if possible, even the chosen ones.”

block.text: Çünki yalançı mәsihlәr vә yalançı peyğәmbәrlәr törәyәcәk. Onlar böyük әlamәtlәr vә xariqәlәr göstәrәcәklәr ki, imkan taparlarsa, seçilmişlәri dә aldatsınlar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, I have told you beforehand.

block.text: Bax Mәn sizә әvvәlcәdәn söylәmişәm.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If therefore they tell you, ‘Behold, he is in the wilderness,’ don’t go out; ‘Behold, he is in the inner rooms,’ don’t believe it.

block.text: Ona görә sizә “bax, O çöldәdir” desәlәr dә, çıxmayın. “Bax, O daxili otaqlardadır” desәlәr dә, inanmayın.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For as the lightning flashes from the east, and is seen even to the west, so will be the coming of the Son of Man.

block.text: Çünki şimşәk şәrqdә çaxıb qәrbdә belә, göründüyü kimi Bәşәr Oğlunun zühuru da elә olacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For wherever the carcass is, there is where the vultures gather together.

block.text: Leş haradadırsa, kәrkәslәr dә orada toplaşar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But immediately after the oppression of those days, the sun will be darkened, the moon will not give its light, the stars will fall from the sky, and the powers of the heavens will be shaken.

block.text: Amma o günlәrin әzab-әziyyәtindәn dәrhal sonra Günәş tutulacaq, Ay nurunu saçmayacaq, Ulduzlar göydәn tökülәcәk, Sәma cisimlәri lәrzәyә gәlәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then the sign of the Son of Man will appear in the sky. Then all the tribes of the earth will mourn, and they will see the Son of Man coming on the clouds of the sky with power and great glory.

block.text: O zaman Bәşәr Oğlunun әlamәti göydә görünәcәk. O vaxt yer üzünün bütün tayfaları şivәn qaldıracaq vә Bәşәr Oğlunun göyün buludları üzәrindә qüdrәt vә böyük izzәtlә gәldiyini görәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He will send out his angels with a great sound of a trumpet, and they will gather together his chosen ones from the four winds, from one end of the sky to the other.”

block.text: O, mәlәklәrini uca şeypur sәsi ilә göndәrәcәk. Mәlәklәr dә göylәrin bir ucundan o biri ucuna qәdәr dörd külәk istiqamәtindәn Onun seçdiklәrini toplayacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Now from the fig tree learn this parable. When its branch has now become tender, and puts forth its leaves, you know that the summer is near.

block.text: Әncir ağacından ibrәt alın: onun budağı cücәrib yarpaqlananda bilirsiniz ki, yay fәsli artıq yaxındır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Even so you also, when you see all these things, know that it is near, even at the doors.

block.text: Elәcә siz dә bütün bu şeylәri görәndә bilin ki, Bәşәr Oğlu yaxındadır, lap qapılardadır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Most certainly I tell you, this generation will not pass away, until all these things are accomplished.

block.text: Sizә doğrusunu deyirәm: bu nәsil ömrünü sona çatdırmazdan әvvәl bütün bunlar baş verәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will not pass away.

block.text: Yer vә göy keçib gedәcәk, amma Mәnim sözlәrim әsla keçib getmәyәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But no one knows of that day and hour, not even the angels of heaven, but my Father only.”

block.text: Lakin o günü vә o saatı nә göylәrin mәlәklәri, nә dә Oğul bilir. Atadan başqa heç kim bilmir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “As the days of Noah were, so will be the coming of the Son of Man.

block.text: Nuhun günlәri necә idisә, Bәşәr Oğlunun zühuru da elә olacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For as in those days which were before the flood they were eating and drinking, marrying and giving in marriage, until the day that Noah entered into the ship,

block.text: Daşqından әvvәlki hәmin günlәrdә, Nuhun gәmiyә girdiyi günә qәdәr insanlar yeyib-içir, evlәnir, әrә gedirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: and they didn’t know until the flood came, and took them all away, so will be the coming of the Son of Man.

block.text: Daşqın gәlib hamısını aparana qәdәr bixәbәr idilәr. Bәşәr Oğlunun zühuru da belә olacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then two men will be in the field: one will be taken and one will be left.

block.text: O zaman tarladakı iki nәfәrdәn biri götürülәcәk, o birisi isә qalacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Two women grinding at the mill, one will be taken and one will be left.

block.text: Dәyirmanda dәn üyüdәn iki qadından biri götürülәcәk, o birisi isә qalacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Watch therefore, for you don’t know in what hour your Lord comes.

block.text: Ona görә dә oyaq olun. Çünki Rәbbinizin hansı gün gәlәcәyini bilmirsiniz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But know this, that if the master of the house had known in what watch of the night the thief was coming, he would have watched, and would not have allowed his house to be broken into.

block.text: Amma bunu bilin ki, әgәr evin yiyәsi oğrunun gecә hansı saatda gәlәcәyini bilsәydi, oyaq qalıb evinin yarılmasına imkan vermәzdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore also be ready, for in an hour that you don’t expect, the Son of Man will come.”

block.text: Buna görә siz dә hazır olun, çünki Bәşәr Oğlu gözlәmәdiyiniz vaxt gәlәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who then is the faithful and wise servant, whom his lord has set over his household, to give them their food in due season?

block.text: Vaxtlı-vaxtında onlara yemәk vermәk üçün ağasının öz nökәrlәri üzәrinә qoyduğu sadiq vә ağıllı qul kimdir?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Blessed is that servant whom his lord finds doing so when he comes.

block.text: Nә bәxtiyardır o qul ki, ağası evinә qayıdanda onu iş başında görür!

ReferenceBlocks.text: Most certainly I tell you that he will set him over all that he has.

block.text: Sizә doğrusunu deyirәm: ağası bu qula bütün әmlakı üzәrindә idarәçiliyi tapşıracaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But if that servant is evil, he will say in his heart, ‘My lord is delaying his coming.’

block.text: Amma hәmin qul pis olub ürәyindә “ağam gec gәlәcәk” deyәrsә,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he will begin to beat his fellow servants, and eat and drink with the drunkards.

block.text: öz yoldaşlarını döymәyә vә әyyaşlarla yeyib-içmәyә başlayarsa,

ReferenceBlocks.text: The lord of that servant will come in a day when he doesn’t expect it, and in an hour when he doesn’t know it.

block.text: o qulun ağası onun gözlәmәdiyi gün vә ağlına gәlmәdiyi vaxt gәlәcәk,

ReferenceBlocks.text: He will cut him in pieces and assign him a place with the hypocrites, where there will be weeping and grinding of teeth.”

block.text: ona ağır cәza verәcәk vә onu ikiüzlülәrlә bir yerdә saxlayacaq. Orada ağlaşma vә diş qıcırtısı olacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW 25
“Then the Kingdom of Heaven will be like ten virgins, who took their lamps, and went out to meet the bridegroom.

block.text: O zaman Sәmavi Padşahlıq çıraqlarını götürüb bәyin qarşısına çıxan on qıza bәnzәyәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Five of them were foolish, and five were wise.

block.text: Onlardan beşi ağıllı, beşi isә ağılsız idi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those who were foolish took their lamps with them but took no oil.

block.text: Ağılsızlar özlәri ilә çıraqlarını götürmüşdü, amma yağ götürmәmişdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The wise took oil in their vessels along with their lamps.

block.text: Ağıllılar isә çıraqları ilә birgә qablarda yağ da götürmüşdü.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now while the bridegroom delayed, they all slumbered and slept.

block.text: Lakin bәy gecikdiyindәn hamısını yuxu basdı vә onlar yatdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But at midnight there was a cry, ‘Behold! The bridegroom is coming! Come out to meet him!’

block.text: Amma gecә yarısı bir qışqırıq qopdu: “Budur, bәy gәlir, onu qarşılamağa çıxın!”

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then all those virgins arose, and trimmed their lamps.

block.text: O zaman o qızların hamısı durub öz çıraqlarını düzәltdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The foolish said to the wise, ‘Give us some of your oil, for our lamps are going out.’

block.text: Ağılsızlar ağıllılara dedi: “Yağınızdan bizә dә verin, çünki çıraqlarımız sönür”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the wise answered, saying, ‘What if there isn’t enough oil for us and you? You go rather to those who sell oil, and buy some for yourselves.’

block.text: Ağıllılar isә cavab verib dedilәr: “Belә olmasın ki, yağ nә bizә çatsın, nә sizә. Yaxşısı budur ki, gedib satıcılardan alasınız”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: While they went away to buy more oil, the bridegroom came, and those who were ready went in with him to the marriage feast, and the door was shut.

block.text: Onlar yağ satın almağa getdiklәri zaman bәy gәldi. Hazır olanlar onunla toy mәclisinә girdilәr vә qapı bağlandı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Afterward the other virgins also came, saying, ‘Lord, Lord, open to us.’

block.text: O biri qızlar da sonradan gәlib “Ağa! Ağa! Qapını bizә aç!” dedilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he answered, ‘Most certainly I tell you, I don’t know you.’

block.text: O isә cavab verib dedi: “Sizә doğrusunu deyirәm: sizi tanımıram”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Watch therefore, for you don’t know the day nor the hour in which the Son of Man is coming.”

block.text: Belәliklә, oyaq olun. Çünki siz nә günü, nә dә saatı bilirsiniz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “For it is like a man, going into another country, who called his own servants, and entrusted his goods to them.

block.text: Sәmavi Padşahlıq sәyahәtә çıxan bir adama bәnzәyir. O, qullarını çağırıb әmlakını onlara әmanәt etdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: To one he gave five talents, to another two, to another one; to each according to his own ability. Then he went on his journey.

block.text: O hәr birinә öz qabiliyyәtinә görә – birinә beş, birinә iki, birinә dә bir talant verdi vә yola düşdü.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately he who received the five talents went and traded with them, and made another five talents.

block.text: Beş talant alan dәrhal gedib bunları sәrmayәyә qoydu, daha beş talant qazandı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In the same way, he who got the two talents gained another two.

block.text: İki talant alan da belәcә daha iki talant qazandı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he who received the one went away and dug a hole in the ground and hid his lord’s money.”

block.text: Bir talant alan isә gedib torpağı qazdı vә ağasının pulunu gizlәtdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Now after a long time the lord of those servants came, and reconciled accounts with them.

block.text: Uzun zamandan sonra hәmin qulların ağası gәldi vә onlardan hesabat tәlәb etdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He who received the five talents came and brought another five talents, saying, ‘Lord, you delivered to me five talents. Behold, I have gained another five talents besides them.’”

block.text: Beş talant alan gәlib daha beş talant gәtirәrәk dedi: “Ağa, sәn mәnә beş talant әmanәt etdin. Budur, mәn daha beş talant qazandım”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “His lord said to him, ‘Well done, good and faithful servant. You have been faithful over a few things, I will set you over many things. Enter into the joy of your lord.’”

block.text: Ağası ona dedi: “Afәrin, yaxşı vә sadiq qulum! Sәn xırda işlәrdә sadiq oldun, sәni böyük işlәr üzәrinә qoyacağam. Ağanın sevincinә şәrik ol!”

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He also who got the two talents came and said, ‘Lord, you delivered to me two talents. Behold, I have gained another two talents besides them.’”

block.text: İki talant alan da gәlib dedi: “Ağa, mәnә iki talant әmanәt etdin. Budur, mәn daha iki talant qazandım”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “His lord said to him, ‘Well done, good and faithful servant. You have been faithful over a few things, I will set you over many things. Enter into the joy of your lord.’”

block.text: Ağası ona dedi: “Afәrin, yaxşı vә sadiq qulum! Sәn xırda işlәrdә sadiq oldun, sәni böyük işlәr üzәrinә qoyacağam. Ağanın sevincinә şәrik ol!”

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He also who had received the one talent came and said, ‘Lord, I knew you that you are a hard man, reaping where you did not sow, and gathering where you did not scatter.

block.text: Bir talant alan da gәlib dedi: “Ağa, sәnin sәrt bir adam olduğunu bilirdim. Әkmәdiyin yerdәn biçәrsәn, sәpmәdiyin yerdәn yığarsan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I was afraid, and went away and hid your talent in the ground. Behold, you have what is yours.’”

block.text: Ona görә qorxdum, gedib sәnin talantını torpaqda gizlәtdim. Buyur, öz malını geri götür!”

ReferenceBlocks.text: “But his lord answered him, ‘You wicked and slothful servant. You knew that I reap where I didn’t sow, and gather where I didn’t scatter.

block.text: Ağası isә cavab verib ona dedi: “Pis vә tәnbәl qul! Mәnim әkmәdiyim yerdәn biçdiyimi vә sәpmәdiyim yerdәn yığdığımı bilirdinmi?

ReferenceBlocks.text: You ought therefore to have deposited my money with the bankers, and at my coming I should have received back my own with interest.

block.text: Onda gәrәk mәnim pulumu sәrraflara verәydin ki, mәn qayıdanda onu faizlә geri alım.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Take away therefore the talent from him, and give it to him who has the ten talents.

block.text: İndi әlindәki talantı ondan alın vә on talantı olana verin!

ReferenceBlocks.text: For to everyone who has will be given, and he will have abundance, but from him who doesn’t have, even that which he has will be taken away.

block.text: Çünki kimin varıdırsa, daha çox verilәcәk vә o, bolluq içindә olacaq, kimin yoxudursa, әlindә olan da ondan alınacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Throw out the unprofitable servant into the outer darkness, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.’”

block.text: Yaramaz qulu isә qaranlıq çölә atın. Orada ağlaşma vә diş qıcırtısı olacaq”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “But when the Son of Man comes in his glory, and all the holy angels with him, then he will sit on the throne of his glory.

block.text: Bәşәr Oğlu bütün mәlәklәrlә birlikdә izzәti ilә gәlәn zaman Öz izzәtli taxtına oturacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Before him all the nations will be gathered, and he will separate them one from another, as a shepherd separates the sheep from the goats.

block.text: Bütün millәtlәr Onun önündә toplaşacaq, O da qoyunları keçilәrdәn ayıran bir çoban kimi onları bir-birindәn ayıracaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He will set the sheep on his right hand, but the goats on the left.

block.text: Qoyunları sağına, keçilәri isә soluna qoyacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then the King will tell those on his right hand, ‘Come, blessed of my Father, inherit the Kingdom prepared for you from the foundation of the world.

block.text: O zaman Padşah sağındakılara deyәcәk: “Ey sizlәr, Atamın xeyir-dua verdiyi adamlar! Gәlin, dünya yaranandan bәri sizin üçün hazırlanmış olan Padşahlığı irs alın.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For I was hungry, and you gave me food to eat. I was thirsty, and you gave me drink. I was a stranger, and you took me in.

block.text: Çünki ac idim, Mәnә yemәk verdiniz; susamışdım, Mәnә su verdiniz; qәrib idim, Mәni qәbul etdiniz;

ReferenceBlocks.text: I was naked, and you clothed me. I was sick, and you visited me. I was in prison, and you came to me.’”

block.text: çılpaq idim, Mәni geyindirdiniz; xәstә idim, qayğımı çәkdiniz; zindanda idim, yanıma gәldiniz”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Then the righteous will answer him, saying, ‘Lord, when did we see you hungry, and feed you; or thirsty, and give you a drink?

block.text: Onda salehlәr Ona cavab verib deyәcәklәr: “Ya Rәbb, biz Sәni nә vaxt ac görüb yemәk verdik vә ya susamış görüb su verdik?

ReferenceBlocks.text: When did we see you as a stranger, and take you in; or naked, and clothe you?

block.text: Nә vaxt Sәni qәrib görüb qәbul etdik vә ya çılpaq görüb geyindirdik?

ReferenceBlocks.text: When did we see you sick, or in prison, and come to you?’”

block.text: Nә vaxt Sәni xәstә vә ya zindanda görüb yanına gәldik?”

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The King will answer them, ‘Most certainly I tell you, inasmuch as you did it to one of the least of these my brothers, you did it to me.’

block.text: Padşah da cavab verib onlara deyәcәk: “Sizә doğrusunu deyirәm: siz bu әn kiçik qardaşlarımdan birinә etdiyinizi Mәnә etmiş oldunuz”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he will say also to those on the left hand, ‘Depart from me, you cursed, into the eternal fire which is prepared for the devil and his angels.

block.text: O zaman solundakılara deyәcәk: “Ey lәnәtә gәlmişlәr, çәkilin önümdәn! İblis ilә onun mәlәklәrinә hazırlanmış olan әbәdi oda yollanın!

ReferenceBlocks.text: for I was hungry, and you didn’t give me food to eat; I was thirsty, and you gave me no drink.

block.text: Çünki ac idim, Mәnә yemәk vermәdiniz; susamışdım, Mәnә su vermәdiniz;

ReferenceBlocks.text: I was a stranger, and you didn’t take me in; naked, and you didn’t clothe me; sick, and in prison, and you didn’t visit me.’”

block.text: qәrib idim, Mәni qәbul etmәdiniz; çılpaq idim, Mәni geyindirmәdiniz; xәstә vә zindanda idim, qayğımı çәkmәdiniz”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Then they will also answer, saying, ‘Lord, when did we see you hungry, or thirsty, or a stranger, or naked, or sick, or in prison, and didn’t help you?’”

block.text: Onda onlar da cavab verib deyәcәklәr: “Ya Rәbb, Sәni nә vaxt ac, susamış, qәrib, çılpaq, xәstә vә yaxud zindanda gördük ki, Sәnә xidmәt etmәdik?”

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Then he will answer them, saying, ‘Most certainly I tell you, inasmuch as you didn’t do it to one of the least of these, you didn’t do it to me.’

block.text: O zaman onlara cavab verib deyәcәk: “Sizә doğrusunu deyirәm: siz bu әn kiçiklәrdәn birinә etmәdiyinizi Mәnә etmәmiş oldunuz”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: These will go away into eternal punishment, but the righteous into eternal life.”

block.text: Bunlar әbәdi әzaba, salehlәr isә әbәdi hәyata gedәcәk>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW 26
It happened, when Jesus had finished all these words, that he said to his disciples,

block.text: İsa bütün bu sözlәri bitirәndәn sonra şagirdlәrinә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You know that after two days the Passover is coming, and the Son of Man will be delivered up to be crucified.”

block.text: <<İki gün sonra Pasxa bayramı olacağını bilirsiniz. Bәşәr Oğlu çarmıxa çәkilmәk üçün tәslim edilәcәk>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then the chief priests, the scribes, and the elders of the people were gathered together in the court of the high priest, who was called Caiaphas.

block.text: O zaman başçı kahinlәr vә xalqın ağsaqqalları Qayafa adlı baş kahinin hәyәtinә toplaşdılar.
